text: The official first event of @edhogmanay is the Torchlight Processional. It owes its heritage to Viking tradition and pagan customs which celebrated the end of a year and the beginning of a new one with fire and flame. Locals and visitors walk with torches

name: Messe Süd
text: This is one of many United Buddy Bears which can be seen all over Berlin. The very first was created in 2001 and since then, hundreds have been seen all over the city with some even traveling to other countries in art exhibitions and displays of peace. Th

name: Santuari Vall de Nuria
text: Our first act, upon arrival at Vall de Núria, was to ride horses up into the mountains above the tree line to take in panoramic views of the peaks. It was cold and quiet, refreshing and clarifying in a way that merely hiking the land might not have been.

name: Timboon Railway Shed Distillery
text: This is the Four Cheese and Zucchini Soufflé that my friend had at Timboon. I don't even care for Zucchini and still I thought this too was INCREDIBLE. If you find yourself anywhere even remotely near Timboon, Victoria don't miss this culinary outpost on

name: MTA Subway (A/C/E/L Trains) - 14th Street & 8th Avenue
text: subway stylin' #NYC #iph100

name: Revel
text: Spending the weekend in Atlantic City (my first time), exploring Revel while I indulge my inner AV geek for the Air Show. It's one shiny, reflective place.

name: SoHo
text: Fitting that I should find myself on my last day in NYC, ending at SoHo Gallery for Digital Art leading a panel on Instagram and Mobile Photography, essentially digital art. In 2011 it was at the same gallery that I had my first mobile phone photo exhibit

name: Canal Street Subway Station J,Z,N,Q,R,&6
text: Quiet Night under the Canal (for #farawaypeople challenge @jayzombie)

name: Times Square Alliance
text: Last night's festivities spat me out into one of the places I usually avoid like the plague in #NYC: Times Square. Then, I caught this little girl in the throes of enchantment with Big Bird. \|\| A nice reminder that it's all about perspective. Childlike

name: Villa Panna
text: I really shouldn't be drinking too much wine or eating too much pasta given that I'm still struggling with a kidney problem. But \when in Rome\"..... Luckily, there's LOTS of delicious #AcquaPanna water to chase it with. Today: I meet Andreas Larsson (Be

name: The Monk and minstrel
text: How do you survive a cold, gray winter in the UK? There are a lot of ways but one of my favorites is Pub Quiz night and a Guinness. (Though they're found around the world, I discovered Pub Quiz for the first time in England and a 2009 study found that the

name: Park City Mountain
text: Long shadows on the slopes! Didn't get to ski today - but I did get on the mountain. More on that soon :) #sundancetrip

name: Sedona Arts Center
text: the hands of the potter #SedonaSony

name: Santuari De Montgrony
text: Mushroom hunting is an important activity in Catalan culture, and many chefs in this part of Spain have made cooking with all the different varieties into almost an art form. In Gombrèn, Michelin-star chef Francesc Rovira took us deep into the forest on

name: Tate Museum Of Modern Art
text: Photography is the language in which I communicate but painting is the language I grew up with. And I still love spending hour upon hour in museums all around the world. Surprisingly, this trip to London was my first visit to the Tate and this girl's enth

name: Umi Hotel Brighton
text: You might not be able to tell, but trust me, my room at @UmiHotels Brighton has the most fabulous views of Kings Road, the old rusted pier and the current Brighton Pier. Its quote is also a nice touch. Must come back in summer when it's proper warm!

name: John F. Kennedy International Airport
text: It turns out it's a lot harder to do my job when I'm no longer running from anything and when I have a home with someone that I don't want to leave -- but work calls and I've had to fly to Brighton, England. If you're at #Traverse13, see you soon! I'll be

name: The Grey Dog
text: nocturnal spring beauty

name: Santuari Vall de Nuria
text: Vall de Núria resort is built around a cathedral & sits on the site of a pilgrimage destination which dates to 1087. So while the valley is now known more for fun, I can well understand a religious focus -- the natural views alone are worthy of fanaticis

name: Cinnamon Tree
text: This delicious Lentil Curry soup at Cinnamon Tree Indian restaurant in Kreuzberg is the perfect antidote to Berlin's frigidly cold late-winter days. While the Indian food here is not as spicy as I traditionally like, the flavors are truly lovely and I wou

name: Palazzo Pubblico, San Marino
text: Though surrounded by Italy and sharing a language, the Republic of San Marino is an independent nation. To express such power, and ultimately independence, they rebuilt an old castle to be an official seat of government in the 90's. It was designed by int

name: Podere San Giuliano
text: After our cooking class with Federica at Agriturismo San Giuliano, we were able to eat the fruit of our labor. Never has a plate of pasta tasted as good as her Tagliatelle Bolognese did. Never will I make the mistake of eating Bolognese sauce with spaghet

name: Urban Bean Co.
text: Just discovered @UrbanBeanCo at the corner of Griswold and Grand River in downtown Detroit. My lovely coffee drink this morning is their Green Fairie Latte which has pistachio and white chocolate. It might be the best fancy coffee I've ever had and the in

name: Detroit Princess
text: Getting out on the river and seeing Detroit by boat with @intuitiveartist @paintthenight has been such a treat. Seems like an entirely different place from this vantage point.

name: Hot Taco Detroit
text: Mexicantown might be the best place to enjoy south-of-the-border flavor in Detroit but I stumbled on Hot Taco, not far from Comerica Park just off Woodward, and it could hardly have been more delicious or more fresh. The chorizo taco with flour tortilla a

name: Fort Lee Historical Park
text: riding under the GWB on a beautiful Sunday in a Miata #iph100

name: Sedona Arts Center
text: It's not all black and white in Sedona.

name: Keystone Lakeside Village Resort
text: Sometimes, the best place to get thinking or writing done -- is in the middle of a river, sitting on a rock, with the mountains in the background and wet feet from slipping into the water between the rocks.

name: Closter Borough
text: @tonyrudick just let me use this - little does he know he's never getting it back #x100

name: Traffic Jam & Snug
text: This is the rooftop garden at Traffic Jam & Snug on Canfield in Detroit. It's not the only rooftop garden in the city and they are not the only restaurant or organization to yield their own produce. There are gardens seemingly every few blocks here. I'm c

name: Cloud City. The Met Roof
text: Every summer some feat of architectural mastery and art is featured in the roof garden on top of the MET. This year's \Cloud City\" does not disappoint. Though, my favorite is still Big Bambu."

name: Elvis Kitchen
text: This is Elvia Staines, known as Doña Elvia by locals. She began cooking in San Pedro more than 50 years ago and the colorful Elvi's Kitchen (on Pescador Drive, in its current location for more than 30 years) is named for her and owned by her. These days,

name: Villa Panna
text: I've always consumed water for the purposes of hydration but rarely been very picky about brands or taste beyond trying to use a purifying pitcher at home. (With one exception: I've never cared for Evian.) My water and wine tasting course with Andreas Lar

name: Sywell Country Park
text: Very often when I'm in the UK, I leave London for Northamptonshire. Something about the Jane Austen addict in me longs to walk down dusty lanes past fields of gold and emerald, book in hand, the sounds of birds and insects my only soundtrack.

name: East India DLR
text: Every sunny morning in London, as I commute on the DLR to my meetings at Excel, I find myself unable to wipe the smile from my face. It is so preferable to being stuck underground on the tube and how different a view of London it is to see Canary Wharf a

name: Jemaa El Fna
text: One of my favorite things about Morocco is the food. This meal in Marrakech, from one of the stalls that pop up at night in Jemaa el-Fnaa Square, was a delicious break from the tagine and cous cous that's so standard in Moroccan cuisine. If you find yours

name: David Geffen Hall
text: Because I was early for a meeting at the Apple Store UWS, I decided to drop by Lincoln Center for some architectural photo funsies. All the years I've lived here on/off, I've never been. I discovered the most wonderful thing, in the Grove next to Avery Fi

name: Hotel Brufani, Perugia
text: #Italy is so idyllic

name: Fedora Restaurant
text: HI! If you've recently found your way here because of my hosting the @NYCbaton...Thank You! It was a great honor to spend one of my few days in the city sharing the things I love and the moments that made another day in this great place so special; a day

name: Federation Square
text: It's been a while since I've posted a non-cropped image here but I couldn't bear to crop this capture of Patrick Dougherty's 'Stickwork' which can be seen here in Melbourne at Federation Square. Long an admirer of Dougherty, I was sooo thrilled to see thi

name: Museo Lamborghini
text: On the way to explore the town of Ferrara, Fabio Lamborghini (nephew of Ferruccio himself) invited us to explore the family Lamborghini museum. I have long loved the luxury car and yet still learned so much! For instance, I didn't know Ferruccio began his

name: Greenwich Point Park
text: man's best friend at the beach during low tide

name: Telford lodge :)
text: I've traveled out to Northamptonshire for a spell with my friends @livesharetravel and the added benefit has been a glorious sunset. I might love London but the country has its divine aspects as well!

name: Trafalgar Square
text: From Nice, France ... to London, England. I've arrived to attend World Travel Market at the Excel Center and before it began I explored a few of my favorite haunts, like: Trafalgar Square. On a sunny day it's a great place to eat a sack lunch, people-watc

name: Covent Garden
text: Warm wishes to you and yours!! \|\| An insta break for a quiet, solo holiday is about to begin. When I'm back: more of London; Edinburgh, Glencoe, Isle of Skye & Loch Ness in Scotland; followed by Melbourne, Sydney, Perth and the Whitsundays in Australia

name: Galata Kulesi
text: In addition to incredible views, our Istanbul apartment has so much character. I'm in love with the collection of antiques, found objects, collectibles and beautiful hand-painted furniture. Against the white walls, it makes for such a pleasing home-away-f

name: Museum of Broken Relationships
text: Established in 2010 I believe, the Museum of Broken Relationships is one of the most intense of any collections I've ever been to. It's award winning and often its contents travel overseas. In parts funny, sometimes awkward, often sad and always slightly

name: The Summit House
text: It turns out, Golden Hour in Colorado is even more golden than in other places. #BOOM

name: Cafebar
text: It's my summer mission to discover the best places for a good meal in Astoria since I'm determined not to go into Manhattan or Brooklyn *every* time I need a good meal. Enter: Cafe Bar on 34th Ave. The service was terrible, though the waiters were pretty,

name: Detroit Metropolitian Wayne County International Airport
text: another day . another airport . another journey begins (Costa Rica bound)

name: Tribeca Towers Health Club
text: Spotting a magnolia tree in full bloom in the middle of skyscrapers downtown ... that brings a smile to this NYers face.

name: Sywell Country Park
text: It may serve as a water tower but I think this lovely little structure would be the perfect summer cottage! Even comes built-in with pet swans.

name: University of Edinburgh Business School
text: The final event of @edhogmanay was a street theatre by French company 'Plasticiens Volants' entitled 'Big Bang'. Animating the history of the world with balloons and atmospheric music set against the backdrop of the University of Edinburgh it was a bang o

name: Eureka Skydeck 88
text: First stop in Melbourne on my #SeeAustralia tour is the Eureka Skydeck 88. It is the highest viewing platform in the Southern Hemisphere and its two elevators are also the fastest, taking you from the ground floor to the 88th, in only 40 seconds. It's a g

name: Aloft New York Brooklyn
text: My fellow NYer @johndeguzman shared an image of our city this morning with the urging not to take it, living here/the city itself, for granted. I definitely try every day not to. Today is particularly easy because of the way I started the day and the gorg

name: Broadgate Tower
text: My preference when visiting any city is always to walk, after that - usually the subway/tube/metro. However, in London, I love taking the bus because it's a very good system that runs almost all night (unlike the tube) and with the 'citymapper' app I neve

name: La Sagrada Família
text: One artist in front of the work of another ... ahhhh, must be Barcelona!

name: South Bank Skatepark
text: Hailed as the birthplace of British skateboarding and a fixture in London's counter-cultural history for over 30 years, not to mention featured in both film and television (even Tony Hawk's video game), the Southbank Skate Center along the Thames is under

name: Mighty Quinn's BBQ
text: Tonight's NYC adventure began with @tevaburns and BBQ [at Mighty Quinn's] then ended, as so many NYC evenings do, on a rooftop. I just love when my friends pass through this city. For the meat photo, check out Jeff's profile. Love the interior of this Eas

name: Villa Panna
text: Farewell Villa Panna! Such a great education in water and wine, such wonderful meals. What an amazing few days. But Florence awaits...

name: Kulture
text: My first, not my last. A plane: for travel, because of all the amazing things it has brought into my life and is continuing to bring!

name: London Heathrow Airport (LHR)
text: BCN to LHR for the last leg of a two month trip ... turns out, two months is just not long enough. There's a palpable sense of sadness at receiving my last passport stamp for who knows how long.

name: Sensi
text: First dinner of this trip to Barcelona had to be tapas and our local connections hooked us up to with what is purported to be one of the best restaurants in the city: Sensi Tapas. Brick walls, candlelight, chandeliers and dishes that made my eyes roll bac

name: Spice Souk
text: As was true in Indonesia, so it goes in Morocco -- it is the people that make a place. This gentleman very kindly welcomed us into his booth, talked with us at length even when we bought nothing and smiled and obliged me when, in my broken French, I asked

name: Traffic Jam & Snug
text: I spent some time with Steve at @MotorCityBrewTours, talking about his great bus/bike/walking tours as well as the craft beer and spirits culture in and around Detroit. Of course, we couldn't talk about craft beer and not sample it. So this is our flight

name: Mille Miglia
text: Continuing our investigation of auto history in the @turismoer region of Italy, tonight we're in medieval Ferrara for the annual Mille Miglia, sponsored by @Chopard and @MercedesBenz. Though we'll see 400 classic and luxury cars from all around the world,

name: Governors Island
text: Sunday on Governor's Island \|\| Bike riding is a must. Of course, it's also smart if you pay attention to the events (there are always a few) and come prepared for, say - the Jazz Age Lawn Party. Today was the last of the year! Wow summer flew by.

name: Badia Palace, Marrakesh
text: At one time, there was a thriving Jewish population in Morocco. In cities like Fes and Marrakech, large areas still act as evidence of the past because the buildings they inhabited are very distinctive. Instead of a Riad, on the top level, balconies and l

name: National Portrait Gallery
text: The National Portrait Gallery in London is one of my favorite places to while away any amount of free time. Then today, I learned that one of the public galleries was the site of a 1909 murder-suicide wherein a man shot his female companion and then turne

name: QT Sydney
text: There are soooo many vignettes I could feature from the QT design hotel in Sydney. It is the most eclectic space I have ever had the privilege to stay in and it has set a new bar for me in hotel living. As a full time traveler, hotels can begin to blend t

name: Team O'Neil Rally School And Car Control Center
text: The setting for our Rally driving experience with @britespokes this weekend, just two miles from my home state of Vermont, in New Hampshire -- it was 600 acres of forest, trails, loose gravel pads and slalom. So. Much. Fun.

name: El Far de Sant Sebastià
text: We ate lunch, we looked at Roman ruins, we created garlic allioli and we learned how \pa amb tomaquet\" is put together. But the view might be the very best part of our afternoon #InCostaBrava"

name: Nom Wah Tea Parlor
text: I'm not prone to true street photography as much as many of my colleagues in #iph100 or in groups like @instagramnyc. However, today during filming in Chinatown for www.bitesofthebigapple.com - I simply could not resist capturing a portrait of this man wh

name: Cape Lodge
text: It's not difficult to pick a favorite part of my stay at Cape Lodge in @MargaretRiver, it was the two hours I spent with Chef Tony Howell and the dinner that followed that evening. He and his restaurant are the highlight of the resort. The restaurant is a

name: Al Coccio
text: This is what I love about knowing locals in the places I travel: we've left Bologna for a night in Milan and @iosnapper (also @finedininglovers) has introduced us to the best bar on the Navigli canal. Al Coccio has great jazz, a bookshelf corner with lea

name: New Yorker Hotel
text: Seen from the right angle and location, it's funny how perspective makes the New Yorker Hotel's sign the same size as the Empire State Building. You can see it too, standing on the north side of 34th between 8th and 9th.

name: Strata SE1
text: So far, this trip to London hasn't been about any of the usual tourist things that bring so many people to the UK. In fact, I've really experienced a different side of one of my favorite cities. The view from my hostel illustrates this well. Such modern a

name: Kimber Lane
text: Kimber Lane, in Sydney's Chinatown, was once a smelly back alley that wasn't pedestrian friendly. Then, the city hired artist Jason Wing who spent 18 months decking the alley out with murals of clouds, hanging sculptures that glow at night and even etchin

name: Mta Steinway St On M,R Lines
text: I'm taking myself, my @tieks and my new @loandsons bag out to the country for a little adventure. As I haven't left the city since moving back in May, it's time. Wanderlust is killin' me and adventure is calling....

name: Barneys Warehouse Sale
text: It's a bummer weather day in NYC! But there is good news: 1) The makers of my favorite iPhone accessory, the @OlloClip are giving one of their lenses away. Check them out for details/rules/to enter. 2) The @InstaGrits collective started a new tag: #Gritty

name: Aerodrom La Cerdanya
text: To ride in a hot air balloon requires much preparation and a very early morning. Even after all the work, sometimes a 2 degree difference in wind speed can prevent a scheduled ride. The valley of La Cerdanya in the Pyrenees is one of the best places to tr

name: Candi Borobudur/Borobudur Temple
text: Sometimes the grand sweeping vistas are best and then sometimes...all the beauty is in the details. \|\| Borobudur Temple . Magelang, Central Java, Indonesia

name: Der Würgeengel
text: Along with @velvetescape and @theplanetd I spent an afternoon with the very lovely Martina who owns this property and several others in Kreuzberg which she lists with www.HouseTrip.com. She and her husband have traveled the world and their apartments refl

name: Club Med La palmeraie
text: My home during my time in Marrakech was the Club Med La Palmeraie. While I think it is best for couples and families, I was really grateful for it as a place to stay -- so zen and calm, in contrast to the complete sensory overload that was the souk, medin

name: The Houses of Parliament
text: #London is a fickle woman weather-wise. But when she's good, she's GORGEOUS!

name: London Heathrow Airport (LHR)
text: I love being in England between my work trips in Europe so it's sort of hard to leave. Not as hard when I'm dashing off to see my love before I have to be in Brighton for a conference. NYC, here I come...

name: Bevagna PG
text: Bevagna is a beautiful town in Umbria, Italy. And it made for a wonderful post #TBUMBR experience.

name: Masala Zone Covent Garden
text: It would hardly be a complete visit to London without a proper curry night. And as delicious as the food was, always is at London's good curry houses -- tonight, it was the decor at Masala Zone that had me smiling.

name: Belle Isle Park
text: Belle Isle Park is, as it sounds, an island right in the middle of the Detroit River. From its banks you can see the United States and Canada. I think it's the best place to see the city skyline other than via boat if you @VisitDetroit. It also houses The

name: Salvation Taco
text: Where do you eat lunch when you're meeting with the über cool @wanderloz for a status update on @afarmedia projects? Duh. @aprilbloomfield's @salvationtaco on 39th in the Pod Hotel. Also, you put your brave panties on and you try Guacamole for the first

name: Egyptian Theatre
text: one of the most well known of #sundance theatres #instawalksundance

name: Basilicom
text: Berlin and its architecture again... The street in Kreuzberg that this was taken on is called \The Tuscany of Berlin\". Locals feel its large trees and the wider-than-normal avenue combined with all the cafes and coffee shops with outdoor seating make it

name: The Coffee Shop Restaurant
text: Always brings back memories when I walk through Union Square. Coffee Shop was the first meal I had on my first day in New York City. I was treated snobbishly by the model waitresses and the food was, as it still is, overpriced. But I was wide eyed and sta

name: Lincolnville Ferry Terminal
text: Then again, even mostly devoid of color, Maine is still powerfully alluring. There's just something about the harbors covered in fog, the black glass quality of the water, the hint of a lonely boat...

name: Greenwich Point Park
text: a bench and a tree with a view (when it's not overcast) \| at the Atlantic Ocean in Connecticut

name: Vasse Felix
text: First stop in Margaret River, south of Perth: Vasse Felix. They were the first vineyard and winery established in this WA wine region, in 1967. Their 'Cane Cut' Semillon dessert wine was incredible, sweet without being too sweet; as was their Cabernet Mer

name: Sit & Wonder
text: Trying to enter a new era, wherein I only drink my coffee black. This is proving difficult but is important for health reasons since I have too much sugar in my diet. Anyone else struggle with this? Tips?

name: Borough Market
text: My love @dante8 has arrived in London so we can travel to Italy together and I could not help taking him to Borough Market. Nor would such a visit be complete without a sandwich from Hobbs. The wholesale part of Borough is open every weekday morning but m

name: Monestir de Montserrat
text: Leaving the Pyrenees, headed for Barcelona, we passed the stunning rock formations of Montserrat #InCostaBrava. Didn't get close enough for really detailed images so instead I captured this through our bus window. I want to come back and explore that area

name: Artists & Fleas
text: If I'm really going for it, no trip to Williamsburg is complete without a stop at the indoor market: @ArtistsAndFleas. In W'burg they're located on North 7th by East River Park, open Saturday and Sunday year-round from 10AM to 7PM. They're also now in pop

name: Camera Obscura and World of Illusions
text: Camera Obscura museum on the Royal Mile in Edinburgh is a collection of oddities, illusions and afternoon diversions. From the entrance, the fun starts immediately. Don't miss the show & views of the city from the roof! #blogmanay

name: Forth rail bridge
text: Finished in 1890, and the iconic backdrop of @edhogmanay's Loony Dook New Year's Day plunge since 1987, the Forth Rail bridge is a feat of engineering. The bridge next to it was finished in 1960 and already needs to be replaced!

name: Blue Belize
text: The first thing I notice in Belize is that, as I hoped - given its location in Central America and proximity to the Caribbean, it is colorful and full of energy in all the right ways. Day 1 has been consumed with a long drive all the way from Belize City

name: Calton Hill
text: When the Torchlight Procession reaches the top of Calton Hill, there's a lot of waiting around, if you've been amongst the first to arrive. As a photographer, I loved being present for that this year because the little moments between people, lit only by

name: McLaughlin's Lobster Shack
text: Couldn't pass this misty, rocky beach and not take photos. It was another instance of the rocks and the seaweed on the beach being so colorful. Maine was shocking in this way, even when the sky was gray, there was color if you looked for it!

name: Constance Le Prince Maurice
text: I had a lot of good meals at @constancehotels Le Prince Maurice but this Asian Noodle Bowl is haunting my dreams day and night. Surely there's a place in NYC where I can get something similar (??) but for now I can do nothing but crave the flavors of spic

name: Las Vegas Convention Center
text: My token #CES2014 floor shot. Curved TVs are one of the two most popular innovations at the conference this year, in-car tech probably comes next. Of course...I was more interested in the cameras and smartphone tech but I've yet to find the perfect camera

name: Hostería del Mar, Puerto Rico
text: taking my first actual vacation in longer than I can remember -- including no computer and trying to stay off social media channels \| also pouring a little rum in the ocean for Eric \| see you all in a few days with lots of photos to share

name: Timboon Railway Shed Distillery
text: Also along the inland road from Port Fairy back to Melbourne, is Timboon Railway Shed & Distillery. It's an artisanal stopover that offers local whisky, produce, incredible coffee, salads, Australian beer and more than you'll ever be able to consume in on

name: Denizler Kitabevi
text: If you find yourself in trendy, western Beyoglu look for the antique book seller and curiosity vendor: Denizler Kitabevi, the \Pearl of Pera.\" I could have spent hours in this store perusing antique travel posters (one of my obsessions), first edition T

name: Le Panier
text: I spent some time wandering the oldest section of Marseille, Le Panier, and while I didn't find the galleries and boutiques that I hoped to find open on a Sunday...I did find lots of my favorite type of free culture: street art! This piece was one of the

name: The Royal Yacht BRITANNIA
text: Toured the Royal Yacht Britannia this afternoon which was decommissioned in 1997 and is now moored in Leith. Behind those windows, the Royal quarters. If you like ships and naval history, or you're interested in the family, it's a fun tour. (If neither, w

name: National Museums Scotland
text: I love the varying architectural styles at Edinburgh's National Museum of Scotland. I was looking up in one of the more modern areas when I decided I needed a photo and, upon the occasion of my retrieving my iPhone, noticed this woman looking up with the

name: Antica Pesa
text: View from my apartment window in Rome ... Viva Italia!

name: Piazza del Comune
text: a moody day up on the hill in #Assisi but that isn't keeping everyone inside #TBUMBR

name: NY Sports Club
text: Golden Hour is my favorite time of day in the city of New York. From the roof of my building in Dumbo to Chelsea and the winding streets of the West Village...I could never take enough photographs of the city during this time.

name: Irish Hunger Memorial
text: Ireland is not the only country on the planet to ever experience hunger but it is the country of focus in Battery Park City's 'Irish Hunger Memorial' and yet what I love most about this NYC commemoration is that it's become a symbol of how serious a probl

name: Hotel Vall de Nuria
text: First sighting of the beautiful Vall de Núria from our train, including a fisherman. \|\| It's a paradise nestled in the Pyrenees mountains with activities to please all year long though it's probably best known as a ski resort.

name: Camera Obscura and World of Illusions
text: My favorite thing at Camera Obscura! -- A plasma globe has filaments that extend from the inner electrode to the outer glass insulator, giving the appearance of multiple constant beams of colored light. Invented by Nikola Tesla, modern versions were first

name: Falls Of Dochart
text: The Falls of Dochart are Scotland's most photographed falls. Located in a beautiful Scottish village with a winding road, it's a very romantic and atmospheric place in the mist and grayness of a typical day. One of the many places in the country ideal for

name: Villa Panna
text: Acqua Panna ® bottles their natural spring water in the hills of Tuscany on the slopes of Mt. Gazzaro in the Appennines. The source flows for 15 years deep in the earth and surfaces in a 1,300 hectare reserve that has been preserved since the Medici fami

name: Acadia National Park
text: When the sun went away, we explored inland in Acadia National Park and I kept thinking of the work of @kevinruss as we wandered through the dense woods. Didn't seem to matter the weather, there was always something to photograph.

name: The Gleneagles Hotel
text: Scotland can't only be about beautiful landscapes, bittersweet history and serene harbours. I spent a night at Gleneagles Resort & Spa and wow did I fall in love with the luxury life. It's the kind of place a woman can feel like a queen and a man could be

name: City Square
text: Melbourne has extended their support of public art to all kinds of surprising places. I particularly loved these knitted trees downtown. How can one not smile at a whole grove of rainbow trees?! #SeeAustralia

name: Spice Souk
text: The men pictured here are observing one of the calls to prayer during midday in Marrakech. I broke a usual rule of mine to take this photograph because after all my time spent in Turkey and Morocco, this is what I am convinced of: Islam is a widely misund

name: St. Paul's Church
text: Truly putting the 'garden' in Covent Garden Market's bustling center, this tiny garden hidden behind gates and buildings and St. Paul's Church is a revelation on a spring day in London. It's free to enter but does close at dusk. When you need a place to e

name: Yankee Stadium
text: Friday night in NYC thanks to @Sony! Great box seats for the Yankees v Giants with @wanderloz @callangreen @janesebee22.

name: Lyon Grill
text: gorgeous sunset to begin my last night in MI w/ the girls

name: Podere San Giuliano
text: Last month in AFAR Magazine, my friend David Farley had a terrific feature on Bologna and its famous Ragu. I'm ashamed to admit, it was all news to me. I'm definitely an American who thought the sauce went with spaghetti. GASP!! Luckily, between David's a

name: Alleva Dairy
text: Little Italy isn't convenient to my home in Astoria but I'd travel 3x the distance without thinking twice for the Italian-imported cheeses, olive oil and cured meats available from Alleva (pictured here) and Di Palo's on Grand Street. Now that I've been t

name: Jing Fong Restaurant
text: #instagramnyc #chinatown #streetphotography #iph100 #nyc #manhattan #portrait #igersnyc #igersny #iphonesia #instagramhub

name: Strawberry Fields, Central Park
text: Yes, let's. \|\| Only, instead of just imagining, let's go out and actually make it -- that better world Lennon imagined. Let's choose to live in peace with each other. And choose love over hate.

name: Natural History Museum Ice Rink
text: I love London at Christmas! I love history. And, I love ice skating. What better way to combine all three than to spend an evening at the Natural History Museum's ice rink! It's one of many rinks in the city over the winter and @TimeOutLondon's site has a

name: Melbourne Exhibition & Convention Centre
text: I also toured Melbourne informally with the very talented Street photographer @Will_Watt of www.melbournestreet.net and we discovered a mutual love for architectural photography! If you too are into that, Melbourne is a terrific city to sate that appetite

name: Brooklyn Flea!
text: No quick trip to NYC is complete for me, without hitting a market or a flea and these donuts at the Sunday Williamsburg Flea definitely made the hour long subway ride from Astoria well worth it. Try the salted caramel & chocolate, it was my favorite!

name: Nest
text: You might not think a \bankrupt city\" would have a lot of great shopping but I discovered a number of wonderful boutiques here in Detroit that are simply divine, all in Midtown: Nest (shown here), @ThankHugh, @NoraDetroit & @CityBirdDetroit."

name: InterContinental Carlton Cannes
text: Cannes: sunshine. palm trees. luxury brands. celebrities. hot cars. gourmet food. A paradise for the privileged. I wish I was going to have longer here, to discover what other stories exist in this town. For surely, there are some. Still, as I look up at

name: Pivnica Medvedgrad Ilica
text: Evidence we have done as the locals do, we have paused from sightseeing to engage in people watching. Over coffee. Unlike Italy, they do enjoy cappuccino post-breakfast here in Croatia.

name: Keystone Lodge & Spa
text: Through this tunnel is the coffee and then the learning ... without coffee and on only two hours sleep, the walk feels far more psychedelic than it should.

name: Culloden Battlefield
text: On 16 April 1746, Charles Stuart's Jacobite army of Scottish men met British government forces led by the Duke of Cumberland at Culloden near Inverness. The resulting battle was deadly, with near or over 2,000 casualties and an almost complete end to the

name: Venmo
text: Today I'm hanging out in a Mr. Softee truck with @uber_nyc helping distribute ice cream to Uber users who order a delivery using the car service app! It's happening in 33 cities in 10 countries and you can follow the fun by checking out #UberIceCream here

name: Via Garibaldi
text: The Palazzo Carrega Cataldi is the current Chamber of Commerce for Genoa. Pictured here is the Golden Gallery done in Rococò style dating to the eighteenth century though the rest of the building dates to the 1550s. It is amongst the many historic Palazz

name: Tower Hill Reserve
text: Tower Hill, along the inland route from Port Fairy back to Melbourne, is the site of a now-extinct volcano. So named by the English because of the way a castle-like structure with what seemed like a moat was created on the site the last time the volcano e

name: Aéroport Paris Charles De Gaulle CDG
text: in between

name: QT Sydney
text: Do you see the Elephant? This beautiful cup of coffee art was created by the talented Barista at QT Hotel in Sydney and, for me, perfectly represents the extraordinary but all-too-short experience that my stay there was. I cannot highly enough recommend t

name: Sky Ride Ferris Wheel Fremantle
text: My first stop in Western Australia: the beach towns of Cottesloe and Fremantle outside Perth. \Freo\" as I heard it lovingly called is one part bustling port, a ferry stop for vacationers headed to Rottnest Island, thriving arts scene, a former military

name: New Zealand High Commission
text: I spent a very lovely afternoon behind-the-scenes interviewing the team at www.TripTease.com and while I'm embargoed from sharing the fruits of that labor for just a little bit longer, I couldn't resist this :: It's a sign in the co-op work space they inh

name: Monestir De Sant Pere De Rodes
text: As we journey along the Costa Brava coast, headed toward the Pyrenees, we find ourselves with more serene views like this. Small towns, stunning hills, the beautiful ocean... Falling under the spell of #InPyrenees #InCostaBrava

name: Palazzo Tursi
text: I've arrived in Genova - the capital of Liguria, the sixth largest city in Italy and the country's largest seaport. The beautiful old town of Genoa has been a UNESCO site since 2006 and it is that which makes it so classically Italian, though looking back

name: Piazza del Duomo
text: Confession: My first impression of Milano was not a great one. From the train station to where I stayed outside the center I saw nothing but ugly, modern office buildings. Then, I took a @walksofitaly tour and I discovered landmarks like the Duomo. Milano

name: ARIA Resort & Casino
text: I'm a sucker for fresh flowers and striking art. @arialv has both in abundance in their Sky Suites private area. This is a side of Vegas I could get used to. Sadly, the smoke smell in my clothes from last night? Not my cup of tea. Win some, lose some. (Pu

name: Gornji Grad
text: This lovely woman is selling a traditional gift exchanged between lovers, a decorated red heart with a mirror embedded toward the bottom. A similar motif is also one of the symbols of the city of Zagreb and red itself is a very common color here.

name: The Queens Kickshaw
text:
I don't know where all the nasty weather that was promised ran off to, but I do love that there was enough precipitation to make the leftover fall leaves glisten like jewels! 🍂🍃🍁\
 (And a little pop of @vsco to help. They're having a huge sale tod

name: Jardins De Santa Clotilde
text: Forget the tourist beach -- THIS is the stretch of water I claim as my own #InCostaBrava

name: Southbank Centre
text: Arrived in London and while I've been too sick to venture out so far, once I finally did today I discovered spring has finally sprung in the city!! These airstream trailer food trucks along the Thames on the south side are one of my favorite things. Next

name: Maya Beach Hotel Bistro
text: Don't be fooled by the empty seats or the unassuming nature of this simple looking bistro in Placencia, on the ocean. Maya Beach Hotel's Bistro serves some of the best food I've ever had, anywhere. Owners John & Ellen have created a menu which features th

name: Laughing Man
text: After being spoiled with good coffee in Europe and Australia, I had to find my place immediately on return to NYC; my place where I can depend on always walking out with an excellent cup of coffee. Sadly, though they make my favorite -- the Flat White --

name: Sapphire Point Overlook
text: We've already got the locals eating out of our hands! #TBEX

name: Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park, London
text: This morning in London, it's been my great privilege to hang out again with my friends from @costabravapirineu to learn about the new project by the brothers behind Girona's El Celler de Can Roca: Joan, Jordi and Josep. They currently helm the second best

name: Al Pont de Ferr
text: Also in Milan, @iosnapper took us to @mpchef's restaurant 'Al Pont de Ferr' which represented @dante8's first experience with molecular gastronomy of any kind. I was so pleased to dine with yet another chef influenced by Spain's Roca Brothers yet the meal

name: Coney Island Beach & Boardwalk
text: Red-painted toes, blue & white bikini, sand between my toes and @dante8 beside me. A happy 4th of July! ((Did you know there are over 200 languages spoken in NYC?! I learned that today and it seems really appropriate since this is the birthday of a countr

name: Hyde Park Local
text: Downtown Sydney's Hyde Park, similarly named but looking nothing like its London counterpart, is the oldest public parkland in Australia. Already my favourite part of the 40 acres are the large fig-tree-lined boulevards that make me think somehow of Paris

name: Isham
text: My friends here in England, say I can have honorary citizenship because ever since this blue sky appeared, I can't stop talking about the weather: \It's a very British occupation.\" Never mind none of us can remember the last time we even SAW blue sky! A

name: Santa Elena, Cayo, Belize
text: Testing the new #VSCO app with one of the many colorful flowering bushes found all over Belize. It rained every day but one and while that's not ideal for photos, the natural world certainly made for a very colorful, lush switch from the gray skies. Every

name: Fresh Salt
text: This Fri night, the drinks are on @stoli as @dante8 and I join @bridif @mmlnyc @takinyerphoto @johndeguzman @sweatengine etc etc for a photo walk through lower Manhattan. Follow the fun with the #StoliOriginal hashtag. (And to create your own refreshing s

name: Mulberry Street Bar
text: I love the middle ground that flirts with the edges of both Little Italy and Chinatown, yet belongs to neither, really. The colors in this building particularly grabbed me. It's why I return over and over even though I abhor the crowds. I can't resist the

name: Mountain View Grand Resort & Spa
text: Of course when you're going hot all day in rally cars and listening to instructors scream directions while mud flies in your face through the open window -- it's good to have a beautiful place to rest at night. @britespokes definitely nailed it with they

name: Abhörstation Teufelsberg
text: Teufelsberg has some of the coolest dark corners of any graffiti haven I've ever been in. A Cold War relic that was once a Spy Station for Americans, it's now a place that fosters creatives, lovers of good techno and a general atmosphere of freedom of exp

name: Kiva, Galata
text: I've had trouble finding fresh salad ingredients in our neighborhood around Galata Tower (maybe I don't wake up early enough in the morning?!) but the fresh fruit has made me feel like I've won the lottery. Definitely a highlight of the food experience in

name: Bethesda Terrace, Central Park
text: Played the stereotypical tourist in Central Park today with @dante8 and while he choose to capture the classic silhouette shot of beautiful Bethesda Terrace, I had to go with something that shows my favorite details: the frescoes and archways on the groun

name: Hyde Park Local
text: This is the little area in Hyde Park, where I sat and had my first meal in Sydney this morning. As I ate my picnic lunch, I watched these men play chess. I thought of the movie 'Searching for Bobby Fishcer.' I thought of how it was one of my favourite mov

name: Tiny's & The Bar Upstairs
text: One thing I very much did miss about NYC: a good Bloody Mary. Thanks to @abbytegnelia @nomadicmatt for the date at Tiny's where their BM's very much impress. In my tops list now, with Sunburnt Calf & Pastis.

name: James Beard Foundation
text: So glad I also arrived home in time to attend a dinner in celebration of @australia by the incredible @wolfinkitchen presented by @afarmedia at @beardfoundation house. I've been a fan of Australian wine and cuisine since I visited the country in February

name: Terrasse des Galeries Lafayettes
text: Also on the roof of @galerieslafayette, is the winter cafe with chocolate and food by @jeanpaulhevin. It's one of many dining options at the galeries. The tarte, salad and brioche are all delicious but the hot chocolate with chestnut is a specialty and I

name: Green Dot Stables
text: With just over a year in business, Green Dot Stables is still new but owner Jacques and his wife took over a building in Corktown that isn't new. Instead, they took it from abandoned and historical to historical but fresh. A new menu presided over by Les

name: Puigcerdá
text: Through that valley is Andorra...one of the world's very smallest sovereign nations (but not the smallest). From where I stood taking this photo, in the bell tower of Puigcerdà, I could see Spain, France and Andorra. Not so often one gets that chance! A

name: Water Castle Tamansari
text: There are several former and current residences of the Sultan in Yogyakarta. This is the water castle which was his vacation residence, and -- the playground in which he would find his next wife. He, of course, had more than one. From a tower overlooking

name: The Royal Pavillion
text: The Royal Pavilion is one of Brighton's best known landmarks. I wonder if that's because it's so exotic looking?! It was built initially for the Prince Regent, between 1787 and 1823, as a pleasure palace. Now it is like a museum, containing one of the fin

name: Lady M Cake Boutique
text: The day to day life of being a freelance travel writer can actually be pretty boring. When I'm not on the road, my hands are glued to a laptop and I'm on an IV drip of coffee or water. However, sometimes friends like @sivanaskayo ask you to take part in a

name: Forum
text: The weather has changed several times today in Zadar. Just in the timespan it took to take this photo, twice over, but I didn't mind the threat of rain which hovers just above the \Pillar of Shame\" and paving stones that are Roman, installed when the gr

name: The Timbers
text: What will I miss most about Colorado? Rolling up my jeans and wading into the cold, clear depths of the rivers that dot the valleys. There's just something about a mountain river that makes me feel at home and at peace.

name: Cottesloe Beach
text: Even though Australia is renown for its beaches -- it wasn't until I was at Cottesloe that I was finally able to sport a bikini, get sand between my toes and body surf a few waves. So. Much. Fun!! But it was the sunset on Cottesloe Beach that I loved most

name: Basilica di San Petronio
text: Inside Basilica di San Petronio in Bologna, is one of the most controversial pieces of church art anywhere I've traveled. Within a mural depicting Dante's Inferno, is a representation of Muhammad. Police guard the basilica, to protect it from fanatics who

name: Madison Square Park
text: Red, Yellow and Blue' by NYC-based artist Orly Genger has been on display in Madison Square Park since May 1. I love the way the red portion of his three part sculpture, made of nautical paint covered in rope, contrasts so brightly to the green of the pa

name: Warrnambool
text: Middle Island in the town of Warrnambool along the @GreatOceanRoad, is home to Maremma Guardian Dogs which originate from Italy where they are trained to protect livestock. Now, they protect the island's other residents: Little Penguins (once known as Fai

name: Hotel University Bologna
text: What has pleased @dante8 and I most about Bologna, is the frequency at which we encounter the most beautiful and random old frescoes, statues, hidden churches and beautiful tucked away gems. *Like this alcove in a corner of a university building.* The cit

name: A Voce
text: Our staycation at @mo_hotels @mo_newyork also included lunch at @avoce_nyc in the @timewarnercenter. Great choice for unusual Italian food and really wonderful views of Columbus Circle + Central Park.

name: Jardin Majorelle
text: Today, Jardin de Majorelle is owned and managed by the Foundation of Pierre Bergé and Yves Saint Laurent. However, it was begun in 1924 by Jacques Majorelle - a French painter and son of a celebrated furniture maker in France. The garden is known for its

name: Kensington Gardens
text: Another draw of Brighton is the graffiti & street art culture. It doesn't seem to be as extensive as in Melbourne or Berlin but there's a good bit of it and it's all such high quality. I saw quite a few artists at work as well, in broad daylight, which is

name: Sapphire Point Overlook
text: \What are men compared to rocks and mountains?\" - Jane Austen's 'Pride and Prejudice'"

name: Navy Yard Gas
text: I love photographing few things more than abandoned, crumbling buildings. Living in Dumbo, I am not far from one of the most intriguing crumbling places in NYC: The Brooklyn Navy Yards. (fisheye effect achieved w/ @olloclip)

name: Centre Comercial Les Arenes
text: I learned on my second trip to Barcelona that Catalunya has officially outlawed traditional Spanish bullfighting -- here, one of the old rings that is now a shopping mall. Another is now an entertainment venue. Apparently elsewhere in Spain the practice i

name: Royal Opera House
text: The Red Telephone Box is arguably one of Great Britain's best known icons, and a personal favorite of mine. I didn't know that one of the most popular to still be found around London and the world is the 'K6'. In the 20's and 30's when they were populariz

name: Brighton Fishing Museum
text: In Brighton, even when there's a chill, if the sun is out -- you're finding a way to soak it up. Loved this couple unabashedly capturing rays along the beach.

name: Caffè Zamboni
text: It's rather difficult to walk around Bologna and not be constantly taking architecture photos. On a sunny day with a cobalt sky...The color! The details! The history! @dante8 and I need no other distractions or diversions but this.

name: Vermont State House
text: Montpelier, Vermont is the smallest city in the USA to serve as a state capital. It's also the only without a McDonalds in its city limits. Yet the State House is no less grand with a gleaming gold dome, and what architect Stanford White considered to be

name: Hotel Bastion, Zadar
text: I think I fell in love with Zadar at this moment. On an early morning walk through the old town when the sounds of the Sea Organ could be heard echoing off buildings and the light created a golden glow in every tree and a long shadow of every person I pas

name: Kettering General Hospital
text: Did you know flowers aren't allowed in hospitals in England? I didn't. Until @dante8 tried to have them delivered and so did my family. By some miracle, my beloved's flowers were allowed by my bed for a few hours and the flowers my family sent were refuse

name: S Adlershof
text: I've arrived in Berlin! And what a lovely surprise to see the city bathed in light and gorgeous long shadows! #htambassador

name: Cafè Le Bistrot
text: A historic bistro with outdoor seating that feels as if it's more movie-set than real life. Yet, that's Europe. Don't miss eating outside at historic and romantic Le Bistrot if you're in Girona #incostabrava.

name: Musee Picasso
text: Antibes is a stunning old town full of stories... and can date its roots to the Romans and Greeks. Even Napoléon Bonaparte plays into the town's illustrious history because he was very firmly turned away when seeking asylum -- an act which garnered the t

name: Lincoln Street Art Park
text: Though I might wish it, I couldn't stay in Italy forever, and my next assignment has brought me to Detroit, MI in the USA. It has been in the news recently for its municipal bankruptcy but I've come to tell the story of what's REALLY going on in this city

name: Eastern Market Corporation
text: No visit to Detroit is complete without a visit to Eastern Market. Far from being only a produce market, it's a destination for tourists and locals alike to find handcrafted, handmade, antique and fresh goods some of which are even grown in the city limit

name: Washington Square Park
text: While I do love NYC ... it's travel that really makes me most happy. It is happiness for me. So today I leave the city to explore the world, starting in Spain and ending in a place that's truly on the other side of the world. I hope you'll come along for

name: Boulevard Andre Aune
text: Climbing the steps to visit Notre-Dame de la Garde really does make it feel like a pilgrimage. See it in the distance? After the big big hill, I still had thousands of steps to traverse before I finally had the best view of Marseille from its most renown

name: Constance Belle Mare Plage Hotel, Mauritius
text: Someone must have told @ConstanceHotels I was coming and that crepes are amongst my FAVORITE things in the world because this very lovely man, Akshay, made me one today and it turns out, he can make me one every afternoon. In a cafe right on the beach no

name: Basilique Notre-Dame-de-la-Garde
text: The current version of Notre-Dame de la Garde that you see here, which gleams almost white in the sun, is due to Henry Espérandieu (1853-1874) but there has been a chapel on this hill since the 13th century. Extensive renovation was undertaken in 2008 an

name: Long Beach
text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage. - Lao Tzu

name: The Shops At Columbus Circle
text: another #latergram from this weekend's staycation with @dante8 at @TimeWarnerCenter and @mo_hotels @mo_newyork ... I loved all the glass at TWC and the open views of Columbus Circle + Central Park

name: Salon 13
text: Walking around in Alphabet City and spotted this little beauty. It's such a gorgeous Indian Summer day I kind of wanted to take it for a drive; windows down, wind in my hair, good tunes blaring, sun in my eyes... #GoodLife

name: National Museums Scotland
text: The National Museum of Scotland is a terrific place both from an architectural perspective and because of its exhibits which are first class. Today it hosted the beginning of @edhogmanay's Scot:Lands event where visitors spun a wheel to determine their fi

name: Dublin Airport, Aerfort Bhaile Átha Cliath
text: I normally fly direct to London from NYC but this time I'm making a stopover in Dublin that will leave me just enough time to grab a pint of my favorite beer: Guinness, in the motherland. Even though it's a gray Irish morning I'm still smiling as the emer

name: Aeroporto Guglielmo Marconi - Bologna
text: I will always have an enduring love for England. Yet after being soooo sick there and getting out of the hospital only to experience more rain and cold weather...seeing the terra-cotta roofs and green fields of Italy out the plane window today, made my he

name: ARIA Resort & Casino
text: Red Velvet pancakes (OMGYUMGASM) with a side of @nokiaus presents were not a bad way to start my first full day in Vegas. Looks like I won't hit the #CES2014 floor till tomorrow because today we're headed out into Red Rocks. Looking forward to being back

name: Galata Kulesi
text: Arrival in Istanbul was, for me, not immediately a feeling of love. However, when we finally made it to our apartment and our landlord showed us the view from our rooftop, I swooned big time. From our apartment windows or roof, nearly every inch of the ci

name: Norwalk Cove Marina Inc
text: One of my favorite places to be is on a boat and out on the water. Fresh from a cruise around the harbor I couldn't have been much happier in this moment. Unless I'd stayed overnight to get back on a boat tomorrow. Still, a day trip up to the @NorwalkBoat

name: Yallingup Beach
text: There are so many beautiful coves and beaches along the coast of the @MargaretRiver area. (Great surfing too!) What I loved about Yallingup is that the town has only cleared so much land for homes and hotels and will not be clearing more. I could return i

name: Boulevard Andre Aune
text: I decided to walk Marseille for all the research I have to do for my two stories. No big deal! Until.....I got to the top of this hill. I'm not sure any photo can do justice to how steep it actually is and how out of breath I was at the top. But wait till

name: Piazza del Duomo
text: What is very commonly called, simply \the Duomo\" actually includes the Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore, Brunelleschi's Dome, Giotto's Bell Tower, the Baptistry of San Giovanni, the Crypt of Santa Reparata and the Gallery of the Opera del Duomo. Toget

name: Falls Of Dochart
text: One of the things that's so incredible about Scotland in December is how relatively green and lush the land still is. I figured that in winter everything would be dead and gray, instead, there's a very verdant aspect to the trees and shrubs that make up t

name: Muncy Valley, Pennsylvania
text: “Eventually, all things merge into one, and a river runs through it. The river was cut by the world's great flood and runs over rocks from the basement of time. On some of the rocks are timeless raindrops. Under the rocks are the words, and some of the

name: Loggia Dei Lanzi
text: Firenze must spend a fortune in electricity costs because at night the city is lit up like a Christmas tree and I think it's the perfect time to get up close and personal with all the art. The dark of night combined with the intensity of the floodlights c

name: Constance Le Prince Maurice
text: David Benioff wrote, in the book 'City of Thieves', \I've always envied people who sleep easily.\" Well I had no problems sleeping in my bed at @ConstanceHotels Le Prince Maurice. (Maybe the only way my nights could have been improved? The presence of my

name: Exhale Spa
text: Exhale Spa at Revel \|\| Easy to forget there, that just a few floors up is a bustling casino. It's a terrific option if gambling is not your thing. The massage I enjoyed was one of the best I've ever had.

name: Palais Chahramane
text: This symbol found all over Morocco is most popularly known as 'The Hand of Fatima'. In Islam it is so named to commemorate Muhammad's daughter. Levantine Christians call it the 'Hand of Mary', after the mother of Jesus. While its exact origins may be unkn

name: Acadia National Park
text: \Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.\" - Ralph Waldo Emerson"

name: The Gleneagles Hotel
text: I so rarely share photos of me while traveling -- but, this is how much I loved Gleneagles. I thought if I hid in the claw-foot tub, no one would find me and I might just be able to stay forever...

name: Kilt Rock
text: Kilt Rock, so called because from the sea the rock looks like it has a tartan pattern, is attached to a cheeky story of a giant who was saved by his giant wife from a suitor who wanted to kill him and steal his woman. At the end of the crashing, brutal oc

name: Ayasofya
text: The ochre walls inside Hagia Sophia (Ayasofya in Turkish) are really something to behold. In the late afternoon light, when I visited, they seem to glow as if gold is in fact mixed into the paint. When that same light hits the actual gold mosaic tiles tha

name: Belize Zoo
text: The Belize Zoo is a great place to go to see wildlife in close to their native habitat and it's also where a lot of animals are rehabilitated when brought in by locals, injured or close to dying. I really loved seeing all the tropical birds. However, I wa

name: Podere San Giuliano
text: #TravelTuesday \|\| My wanderlust is out of control today. Wish I could kidnap @dante8 from his office and just hop on a plane back to this little spot in Italy. Eat tagliatelle, drink wine, enjoy gelato.... \|\| What are you daydreaming about on this Tue

name: Brooklyn Bridge Park Pebble Beach
text: One of my favorite things about living in Brooklyn is the view of Manhattan. (Tip: I used PS Express 'Reduce Noise' to take away some of the grain inherent with a low-light photo.)

name: Pink Beach
text: Pink sand is interesting but my favorite part of \Pink Beach\" was the snorkeling. While we found out later from dive legend Wally that it isn't even the best place to see coral and fish -- it was the best place I've ever been. If you're a diver, make yo

name: Volubilis
text: If you're into Roman history like I am, there's a lot to love at Volubilis. From the mosaic floors to evidence of heating and cooling systems and the reconstructed temple... there's just so much! But something about this arch just kind of got me!

name: Washington Square Park
text: This is what I love about living in NYC: I can be sitting, hard at work writing, when I get a message that two friends from England & Australia are in town only for a few hours and \Do you want to meet for Japanese takeout at Washington Square Park before

name: Palazzo Vecchio
text: The ornate interior of Palazzo Vecchio is a feast for the eyes and for the art enthusiast or history-obsessed traveler. It was once a palace for the powerful and fascinating Medici family and is now the seat of the mayor of Florence and site of much gover

name: Stephanstraße
text: Also: doors of Berlin = serious love affair. *swoon* This was taken in the uber-cool Kreuzberg neighborhood. It's the entrance to yet another incredible www.HouseTrip.com property. #HTambassador

name: Hotel du Collectionneur Paris
text: Champagne and artisan eclairs by @christopheadam at the opulent bubble bar on L'Hotel du Collectionneur's winter patio is definitely the appropriate luxury start to this experience in Paris with @francepassionmagazine. Sitting on fur blankets with candlel

name: The Breakfast Club
text: \home\" is a big theme in my travels...the search for a place that could be, the meaning of the word, the question of whether it's even something I'll ever fully grasp. however, I realized during this trip to the UK that what began as an inkling more tha

name: Un Dejeuner A Marrakech
text: On the occasion of your first visit to Marrakech, hire a local guide to take you deep into the Souk. It is a massive, living organism that keeps its best treasures hidden (but which a good guide can reveal). The smaller alleyways where not every tourist v

name: InterContinental Carlton Cannes
text: S'il vous plaît Santa, I know it's early to ask for something for Christmas. But if you're real, and you think I've been a good girl, could you please send me to the Carlton for one night and one day to drive this pretty little car around like I own this

name: Cacao Prieto
text: Touring Brooklyn tonight on my first ever #InstaDrive with @LincolnMotorCo and thanks to their direction I now know about Cacao Prieto in Red Hook. Folks, I didn't like dark chocolate until tonight. Theirs is AMAZING. Since they also make liqueurs, it's a

name: Amazing Video Grand Central
text: I have two favorite cliché landmarks in NYC: the Chrysler Building, and Grand Central Station. How convenient for me that they are so close to one another!

name: Edeka Center
text: I have a crush on Berlin's über cool blend of modern architecture and prewar traditional elements. What's most charming is when the traditional has a distinctly artistic spin. In this case: the candy colours of the paint.

name: Acadia National Park
text: I'll be the first to admit I'm definitely an independent feminist by some turns and I certainly found joy by myself for so many years. Yet it's at moments like the one in this picture that I think happiness requires little more than a bit of sunshine, an

name: Geelong Waterfront
text: I've left Melbourne to explore the Great Ocean Road and my first stop is the city of Geelong where colorful Bollards, like the ones pictured here, are a big draw along the waterfront. Created by artist Jan Mitchell and crafted out of the timbers and piles

name: Mas Garganta
text: I have always preferred guest houses or b&b's to chain hotels, Mas Garganta will always be one of my favorites. Is it the staff, the memories here, the history...I don't know. But if you find yourself in the Garrotxa region #InPyrenees and need a place to

name: Eilean Donan Castle
text: Scotland has a lot of coastline, being essentially a series of islands and inlets, which means the sea is a constant presence almost everywhere you go. At Eilean Donan, while everyone else was distracted by the castle, I found myself fascinated with the p

name: Teufelsberg
text: Of all the murals at Teufelsberg in Berlin (and there are MANY) - this was one of the most dramatic. I hope through the inclusion of the door and ceiling you can see the immense size. Otherwise, I'm presenting it without comment. (I believe the artist is,

name: Ayasofya
text: Walking the halls of one of the world's most fought-over pieces of religious property, it's easy to understand why so many people have been so voracious in their desire to own it and control it. It is beautiful and so unusual. Hagia Sophia has been an Ort

name: Station Saint-Laurent
text: This crazy scene brought to you by @visit_montreal's Nuit Blanche. Just one of many outdoor art exhibits that included projections on the side of a building, photographs on TVs stuck in blocks of ice and street art murals on the side of shipping crates. M

name: Bethesda Terrace, Central Park
text: NYC can be a difficult city to actually live in, because it belongs to so many and because it's constantly in flux, disrupted by some thing or some event. Today I just wanted to spend some peaceful time in Central Park but instead we found ourselves surro

name: Trafalgar Square
text: London winter can be so dreary so when the sky is blue and the sun does shine, I love to grab a sack lunch and hang out at Trafalgar Square. Seems one can watch the whole of the city pass by. And when it gets too cold, I simply retreat into the National G

name: Gelateria Gianni
text: Everywhere I go in Italy, people always have suggestions for the best gelato. In Bologna, we were given quite a few suggestions but our favorite has been Gelateria Gianni next to The Two Towers. The hazelnut is the best I've had anywhere in this country,

name: Ponte Vecchio
text: With my hotel just next door, I have ended up crossing the famous Ponte Vecchio many many times during my stay in Florence and I must confess I love it best early in the morning or late at night. The insufferable crowds of midday make it difficult to appr

name: One Square
text: There's a misconception which has been circulating for a long time, that Scotland only serves up Haggis, Chip shops and lots of fried food but the truth is that today's Scottish chefs are utilizing seasonal ingredients from their own gardens, putting thei

name: Coney Island Beach & Boardwalk
text: Supposedly Paul Georgoulakos, in his eighties and still the owner of Paul's Daughter (now more than 50 years old), is the oldest operator on the Coney Island Boardwalk. The popular eatery underwent a significant rehabilitation last year and I love the way

name: Crkva sv. Marka u Zagrebu
text: The Church of St. Marks is one of the most well known in Croatia and certainly in Zagreb. I was giddy when I rounded the corner and saw it, excited to finally lay my own eyes on it after years of seeing other's pictures. The building dates from the 14/15t

name: Urban Angel
text: Lots of love and thanks to @johnnyjet @backpackersteve & @savvyabroad who have recently featured me in their \Instagrammers to Follow\" lists. And a hearty welcome to all my new followers! I hope you'll say HELLO and tell me a bit about yourself and your

name: Auchterarder
text: Places like Perthshire, Gleneagles, Glen Coe, the Isle of Skye and Culloden make me want to move to Scotland and become a full time landscape photographer. If this is your bag and you haven't yet been to Scotland: PACK YOUR CAMERA GEAR.

name: Constance Le Prince Maurice
text: As I don't exactly have time to sit and read on this trip, discovering that Le Prince Maurice has a massive lending library, was both the best and worst thing ever. Torture for an avid reader like me, but such great news for guests who no longer need to p

name: Isham
text: So often I leave London for the countryside. Not just because I have good friends out here but, also because as a girl born amongst farms and mountains, I have a heart torn between two loves: bustling cities and wide open spaces where you can see the star

name: Finalborgo
text: It seems in every small town in Italy, on any square in any village, even in the cities -- if there is an open window, someone is looking out of it, watching the world go by. I wonder if anyone takes the time to be still and appreciate life as well as Ita

name: Forth rail bridge
text: Whatever you do, when you are visiting Scotland, don't fly. Drive or take a train everywhere. The real beauty of the country is its changing and dramatic landscape. Even the bridges [like Forth] are stunning. A train was our method of getting from St. And

name: Kalelarga
text: Kalelarga Street is the oldest in Zadar. Stretching from West to East and said to pre-date the city itself, it is a place that betrays its age because the buildings that line it today are quite modern. Most that once sheltered Kalelarga (or Široka Ulica)

name: Acadia National Park
text: Back in the park, on Stanley Road not far from Seal Harbor, we discovered a river that winds through the Acadia under cover of dense trees and fern. I could have played around with long exposure there forever. (Captured with Slow Shutter app & edited with

name: The Gleneagles Hotel
text: Dining at @TheGleneaglesHotel was another wish come true today. So many courses that I lost track were all cooked in front of us at the chef's table in the demonstration kitchen but it was this salad that made me want to lick my plate clean. Chili, garlic

name: Chiostro Di San Martino
text: This afternoon, @dante8 and I discovered our best hidden gem yet when we wandered into a doorway next to Chiesa di San Martino church off of Via Guglielmo Oberdan in Bologna and discovered the remains of an old Carmelite Monastery that could date back to

name: Belize Zoo
text: Deep inside the Jaguar habitat at the Belize Zoo -- in a similar fashion to when people dive with Great White Sharks -- visitors become the hunted when they step inside a cage to observe the Jaguar in more close proximity than at any other zoo in the worl

name: Galleria degli Uffizi
text: I've been seeing copies of \Birth of Venus\" by Sandro Botticelli ever since I was a little girl, part of art history and coffee table books my artist mother @paintthenight always had around. I believe she's even reproduced it before. And she saw it hers

name: LaGuardia International Airport
text: \Mid pleasures and palaces though we may roam, Be it ever so humble, there's no place like home...\" #NYC"

name: Volubilis
text: Learned something I didn't know about Roman history, on the way from Meknes to Chefchaouen: their Appian way is still well preserved in the NE portion of Morocco. A stop at the ruins of Volubilis was a chance to see incredible mosaic floors, well preserve

name: Pod Grickim Topom
text: I've never eaten chestnuts in any form other than whole, roasted. This dessert was a sandwich of chocolate cakes with chestnut mousse in the middle and I think only one word adequately describes it: YUMGASM. It's safe to say the food in Croatia does not s

name: Sultanahmet Cami
text: The Blue Mosque takes its informal name (really named Sultanahmet Camii) from the blue tulip tiles found all throughout the interior, mostly on the ceiling. Blue tulips are also woven into the sienna rug that covers the floor. Because it is still a functi

name: Darechchaouen
text: Another day in Morocco ends with sunset over our pool at the Darechchaouen guest house. It's a serene end to a beautiful day! Can't wait to share more of the Blue City tomorrow.

name: Lincoln Center
text: How do you top speaking at the Apple Store? You spend a few minutes afterwards with the one you love at one of those magical places in NYC where it feels certain that \making it\" is possible and where you remember why you fell for the city in the first

name: Madison Square Park
text: Chrysler is my favorite of the architecturally significant NYC buildings but I still sometimes feel a little thrill when I happen to look up and catch a glimpse of the Empire State Building. \|\| Gloomy weather but a nice time strolling Madison Square Par

name: Ma Cocotte
text: The story goes that Philippe Starck loves the Marché aux Puches de St Ouen so much, that he asked his friend to open a café in the market. His friend said yes, Philippe designed it and now hundreds of people pass through the doors every Sunday to experi

name: Aerodrom La Cerdanya
text: This is as close as we got to riding in a hot air balloon today. The wind did change after we did all the work of inflating... One technician said as few as 1 in 9 attempts can be successful. #WompWomp

name: Notre-Dame-de-Bon-Secours Chapel
text: I decided to @visit_montreal for the city guide I'm making for @triplespot but I also wanted to experience Nuit Blanche and Lumière. This is how Nuit Blanche began for me, with a performance by the group 'Diversion' in one of Montréal's oldest chapels.

name: Woodbridge, Detroit
text: For a second sitting at this light, I forgot I was in Detroit. Maybe it was the yellow cab. Or the brilliant architecture on the other side of the intersection. Either way, it's just one of the many moments that has surprised me during my stay in Detroit.

name: Constance Belle Mare Plage Hotel, Mauritius
text: I've arrived to Mauritius just in time for the celebration of Divali, elsewhere also called Diwali or Deepawali, which involves the lighting of small clay lamps (diyas) and the creation of colored powder and rice \paintings\" called 'Rangoli' -- it is on

name: Angel at The Waters, Central Park
text: Angel of the Waters' is the stunning fountain at the heart of Bethesda Terrace and the first commission by a woman for a major work of art in the City of New York. It was designed by Emma Stebbins in 1868 and dedicated in 1873. The actual statue of the a

name: Brooklyn Bridge
text: I always see this old lady in black and white. Seems to fit her grandeur best. \|\| Another icon of NYC that I'll miss while I'm off discovering the world. \|\| Took this during a wonderful afternoon with @anniefitzsimmons.

name: Ambassade de Grande Bretagne
text: Ladies: ask a man to join you in Paris. If he accepts, he's a keeper. If he says he'll join you anywhere you ask him to go with you, hold tight and never let go. I love you @dante8.

name: Cottingham
text: \There are two ways to spread happiness; either be the light who shines it, or be the mirror who reflects it.\" - Edith Wharton"

name: Villa Campestri Olive Oil Resort
text: Another gem in the rolling hills of Tuscany is the @villacampestri olive oil resort, spa and restaurant where owner Paolo Pasquali and his daughter Gemma are also educating people about the oft-misunderstood olive oil. We went through a course with them a

name: Plaça De Sant Felip Neri
text: Barely touched down in Barcelona and already busy with a tour. No rest for the weary. But this Catalan woman looked so peaceful, a part of me longed to simply be reading on a stoop just like her.

name: Culloden Battlefield
text: On 16 April 1746, \Bonnie Prince Charlie's\" Jacobite army of Scottish men met British government forces led by the Duke of Cumberland at Culloden near Inverness. The resulting battle was deadly, with near or over 2,000 casualties and a permanent change

name: Ayasofya
text: Perhaps the most difficult subject I've ever had to capture with an iPhone only, is the Ayasofya. The immense space, the complexity of the detail, the crowds of people.... Definite challenge. This shot was taken on the second level looking down at the mai

name: Cafebar
text: {{ moody Saturday after a dramatic Friday }}

name: Otter Point, Acadia
text: First up from my trip to @VisitMaine and @AcadiaNationalPark on Mt. Desert Island with @dante8 is the man himself on the highest cliffs overlooking Otter Point. It wasn't the right time of year to see one of his favorite animals but he sure did love explo

name: Fremont Street Experience
text: Vegas by 🚲 with @nokiaus @bikehugger and foldable bike company Tern Bicycles. We rode from City Center to Downtown's Container Park, on Fremont Street... So. Much. Fun. // www.ternbicycles.com \\\\

name: Candi Borobudur/Borobudur Temple
text: It would be difficult to take too many photographs of Borobudur at Sunrise. It's a paradise of inspiration even if one is not Buddhist or religious. The angles and curves, the details, mixed with the majesty of nature that surrounds the temple is most def

name: 12 Apostles Helicopters
text: There are a lot of ways to see the 12 Apostles along the @GreatOceanRoad. You can hike the GOW with www.auswalk.com.au like I did (highly recommend), drive to the different lookouts or see them via helicopter which departs frequently all day long from the

name: Navy Yard Gas
text: I felt like I was in a 'Fast & Furious' movie tonight with @LincolnMotorCo as we toured BK staying in touch via 2-way radios. Particularly when we stopped at Brooklyn Navy Yard and I managed to capture this shot. Tonight definitely made me think twice abo

name: Pozdrav Suncu
text: Sun Salutation' is alongside the Sea Organ at the edge of old Zadar on the ocean. During the day, its hundreds of solar panels soak up the sun's rays so that at night, a rainbow light show can entertain locals and visitors alike.

name: Galleria Vittorio Emanuele
text: Milan's true claim-to-fame is as a fashion capital. So while my first impression wasn't stellar, once I really walked the city and paid attention to the stores - I did find the most stunning evidence of Italian beauty and craftsmanship, everywhere. One of

name: Ait Ben Haddou
text: Aït Benhaddou is a fortified city situated along the former caravan route between the Sahara and Marrakech along the Ounila River. It has been featured in movies such as 'Gladiator' and 'Kingdom of Heaven' because of its unusual kasbahs. They are in dang

name: Constance Le Prince Maurice
text: The more I've traveled, the more I've come to love wine and champagne. So I enjoyed the fact that @constancehotels Le Prince Maurice has the largest wine cellar in the Indian Ocean with capacity for 35,000 bottles of wine and sommelier Jorald who was name

name: Calton Hill
text: The first day of 2014 has dawned cold but clear here in Scotland and while I'm not one for formally making resolutions, I have been thinking about all I'm grateful for and all I hope for. I'm excited to see what happens in these next 12 months. // If you'

name: Parc de la Devesa
text: In the spirit of, \when life hands you lemons, make lemonade\" -- I rented a bike to run errands today and then the shops were closed for siesta. So, I explored Girona and discovered this gorgeous park. If you're at #TBEX it's actually connected to the c

name: Hayman Island Resort
text: From my private balcony at Hayman Resort, I look out to the ocean and marvel at how complicated it was to get here. All I feel, now that I am here, is peace. Since the sun is out, it's also hard to picture the rain and fierce winds from a cyclone that hav

name: The High Line
text: Today was a gorgeous day in the city ... spent with @dante8, @travelvr, @zachspassport, @walksofnewyork & @wiredjazz. I was doing some equipment testing and we all tested a route for a new photo walk that will be premiering in April. I'm pretty blessed by

name: Portree
text: The irony of the name 'Portree', from the Scottish Gaelic, 'Port Righ' which translates as 'King's Port' -- is that its etymology is supposedly owed to a visit from King James V in 1540, a time that was not peaceful. Why name a town after a king who wasn'

name: Madison Square Park
text: another #latergram from Madison Square Park ... alas, not much going on right now except for LOTS of writing at home {{fun travels later this fall to South Africa, Israel and possibly Croatia though!}}

name: Long Beach
text: Just to my left and right? Hundreds of beach umbrellas, masses of city and suburb escapees. Straight ahead, a little bit of zen. Finally, I feel as if summer has begun.

name: Glengoyne Distillery
text: Today we retreated indoors to Glengoyne Distillery, who've been making Single Malt Whisky since 1833, and we went through a Master Whisky Blending Course. We also tasted the 12 year, 18 year and their unique copper Teapot Dram whisky. Our teacher Arthur w

name: ITB Internationale Tourismus Börse
