text: Realized today that I have a serious addiction to architecture. Modern or otherwise. A little trivia I also learned: Supposedly, the ITB conference housed in Mitte Berlin (shown here) was begun when Berlin was still divided into the East and West as an in

name: Sultanahmet Cami
text: As it's most popularly known, the Blue Mosque is one of the most well known of Istanbul attractions. Construction began on it in 1609 and concluded in 1616. It's still operational as a place of worship while also being open to tourists. It is considered

name: Bir-Hakeim
text: Bir-Hakeim Metro station, known as Quai de Grenelle until 1949, takes its name from the Battle of Bir Hakeim which took place in 1942 in Libya, against Rommel. I remember it from my first trip to Paris, as also commemorating the atrocities which took plac

name: Kapuziner Platz
text: Did you know Milan had canals? I didn't. I also didn't know that they were a bit of a mess and then supposedly this guy (wink!) named Leonardo da Vinci stopped by and penciled in a little plan for how to make them better as he was passing through to do wo

name: Hostería del Mar, Puerto Rico
text: since my beach & stretch of ocean was kite surfing central - I had to learn how it's done (not as \easy as it looks\" ... can't wait to try again!) #PuertoRico"

name: Pink Beach
text: We've switched gears from the intensity and sheer vastness of Bromo, to the beautiful string of islands that make up Komodo National Park. One island, devoid of the Komodo itself, has pink sand beaches and the *best* snorkeling I've ever experienced. THIS

name: Moto-Car, LLC
text: This was another classic that @dante8 and I spotted on the side of the road in Maine. Kinda diggin the two-tone rust and metal treatment. Studebaker? (I wish I knew as much about old cars as I know about photographing them.)

name: 114 Faubourg
text: Our indulgent brunch was followed by dinner at Michelin-starred 114 Faubourg in @lebristolparis and it was the best meal I've ever had in Paris, not just during this trip. My main: beef tenderloin with truffle mashed potatoes & bone marrow. The starter wa

name: Plaça De La Independència
text: The light in Girona this week around 4:30/5 PM is simply stunning. Too good of an opportunity to pass up. I like that this town has such beautifully colored houses similar to other European cities I love, like Innsbruck. Makes for so many photographic opp

name: Acadia National Park
text: Another part of Acadia difficult to contain in a square crop, this was also by Otter Point. A stunning area high above the crashing waves where the rocks were 5 different colors and many pools were to be found in the crevices, some with crab and snails, o

name: Acadia National Park
text: “Our task must be to free ourselves... by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature and it's beauty.” ― Albert Einstein

name: Les puces de Saint Ouen
text: Exploring Marché aux Puces de St-Ouen with @RiadKneife today. He is one of the foremost experts in Paris on its largest antiques and collectors market, open every weekend (and Mondays) since 1885, helping famous people and private collectors purchase, ar

name: Constance Belle Mare Plage Hotel, Mauritius
text: There is a stand of yellow bamboo outside my room at Belle Mare Plage and I've become obsessed with capturing the particular way the light shines through it at different hours of the day. Sometimes the stalks are a neon yellow so bright it hurts my eyes,

name: Edinburgh Castle
text: See the line of Edinburgh Castle silhouetted at the bottom of the photo? Smoke from the fireworks very quickly obscures the view at midnight but still there was something very magical about the display occurring over such an old and lauded landmark. If yo

name: Cafe Boulud
text: After a long tour that was all outdoors, a night in at @cafebouludto in @fstoronto was just my kind of scene. The food + atmosphere live up to the Boulud name, and then some. Trust their sommelier, Drew, when you visit as he knows his wine. He picked two

name: Manhattan Municipal Building
text: I rarely make it all the way down to city hall, the municipal buildings and the courthouse. Huge thanks to @stoli and @mmlnyc for hosting #stolioriginal and taking us through a place I just, forget about. The light at the end of the day downtown is beauti

name: Isham
text: It was cold and rather gray a lot in France, which made me long for summer. Spring and its colorful signs of life make for a decent substitute, for now. Just took this today, the inside of a crocus, for @instagram's #WHPflowerpower with my @olloclip lens.

name: The Real Mary King's Close
text: It's rare to see the bustling Royal Mile in Edinburgh nearly deserted but on New Year's Day morning, it's pleasantly devoid of people. Often the best time for photos of a city is early morning! Happy New Year from the last day of @edhogmanay and I wish yo

name: Marseille
text: Marseille is currently featuring, all along the old port, colorful, painted animals in what they're calling the 'Funny Zoo' Project. Kids are flocking to them and it's a delight to stand and watch. It's all part of the celebration of this region being 201

name: ARIA Resort & Casino
text: I've made it to Vegas. After a lot of delays and some bad flight experiences, this Sky Suite at @AriaLV is quite the balm for a weary traveler. Views of the strip in every room and this is only 1/5 of the suite. Toto, we're not in Scotland anymore... (Her

name: Monument Lane
text: Vintage pearls and a modern lace skirt with a cashmere sweater pair nicely with @dante8, candlelight and a nice glass of Syrah. A gorgeous evening in Greenwich Village makes for the perfect end to a lovely birthday weekend.

name: Bass Harbor, ME
text: After owning a home when I was young and then being a nomad, I don't know if I want a house again. It's certainly not practical now. But I think if I ever did again, I'd want it to be dripping with flowers like this house in Maine...

name: Brooklyn Brigde Park
text: Sunset and Fireworks in NYC make for a very patriotic and fun 4th of July but the best part was sharing it with friends!

name: Bells Beach
text: This is Bells Beach, near the town of Torquay, site of the Rip Curl Pro Classic and setting of the last scene in the film 'Point Break' (though the scene itself was filmed at Cannon Beach in Oregon). Pop Quiz: Is the beach named after John Cavert Bell who

name: Grosvenor
text: I've arrived in London! There are parts of the city that remind me of Paris and today that puts a smile on my face because I will get to return to France in March and that's probably the portion of this European Tour I am most looking forward to...

name: Musée du quai Branly - Jacques Chirac
text: The @quaibranly musée has three things going for it. 1) It is the most unusual, and therefore intriguing, museum I have ever been to in Paris, 2) it is delightfully close to La Tour Eiffel and, 3) its rooftop restaurant -- Les Ombres -- allows you to sam

name: Inveraray
text: I could share a lot more photos from our distillery visit today but they'd make more sense in a blog post later on, as a full story. So goodnight from Scotland, I leave you with one of the thousands of cute little cottages we've passed that I wouldn't min

name: The Dutch
text: This installment of my #WinterStorefront series was created for @dutchdoscher because I still think of him whenever I pass it. Great memories from this joint and the area in general. Dutch was one of my earliest friends in NYC & mobile photography. He's a

name: Bass Harbor Head Light House
text: On a gray day, this was a pretty underwhelming sight. Yet the Bass Harbor Head Lighthouse is one of those iconic places in Maine, that you have to visit when you are in Acadia National Park. It was completed in 1876 and put on the historic register in 198

name: Ayasofya
text: Likely because they're right across from one another, actually facing one another, and because they represent \competing religions\"...there are always comparisons between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia (pictured here). I did like the Blue Mosque. Yet

name: Long Beach
text: Too cold to swim. Too overcast to tan. So @dante8 and I chased sea gulls and took photos in the shallow pools while running from the encroaching waves. Sometimes, having someone to just bum around and adventure with is the best thing about this thing call

name: Capn Nemos
text: Rainy days in Maine require a different kind of search for color. So when we stumbled upon this curiosity, a restaurant, we both had the idea to stop the car at the same time. Just couldn't resist a building covered in ephemera!! -<{ For a more zoomed out

name: Piazza del Duomo
text: ...and then sometimes you find yourself in the place you've imagined being for 20 years and all you can do is laugh out loud and say, \Holy s**t I can't believe I'm in front of the Duomo!\"

name: Hope & Anchor
text: Today's #FriFotos theme is solitude and one of my favorite places to find that in NYC is actually solo dining at cafés. Since I work from home, it's always nice to change up the pace during the day and be alone but also surrounded by other people once in

name: Stirling Castle
text: I'm spending NYE at Stirling Castle for a concert and big fireworks display so today we toured the complex and had lunch in their cafe. This room, part of the Palace Apartments which have been restored to what they were like during the rule of James the 5

name: Stone Street Historic District
text: Starting out Tuesday, back in the city, but again with @verenamei filming a #fiestamovement challenge. An empty Stone Street is not a bad place to hang out and take photos! I love my job.

name: Cattedrale di Santa Maria del Fiore
text: A closer look at Santa Maria del Fiore and Brunelleschi's Dome which is the largest brick dome ever constructed. Most of the basilica's facade is marble in shades of white, pink and green and it's simply stunning in person. Photos can hardly do it justice

name: Park \Angiolina\"
text: Just between the ocean and the town, Park Angiolina is an oasis of exotic plants, trees, palms and flower beds. It's also the site of a large mural depicting the faces of famous people who have visited Opatija. Those depicted include Albert Einstein, Jame

name: Pozdrav Suncu
text: At night 'Sun Salutation' transforms from plain solar panels and glass expanses into a disco-dance-floor-rainbow-party atmosphere where couples come to kiss, mothers dance with their daughters and people like me try to capture long exposures of the full m

name: Coral Tower NYU
text: truly my favorite time of day in NYC (and this one a little reminiscent of Manhattanhenge)

name: Montmartre
text: A lovingly prepared meal in the home of a brand new friend and then a stroll through the quiet streets of Montmartre just as a light drizzle made the cobblestones glisten with the reflections of twinkle lights. Paris is magical. #FrancePassion

name: Constance Le Prince Maurice
text: Would a villa on the ocean in paradise make all problems disappear or do we just carry our problems with us everywhere we go... dreaming of what it would be like to live in a tropical villa like this one at @constancehotels Le Prince Maurice today.

name: Niagara On The Lake Ice Wine Festival
text: Almost everything is set against a backdrop of white today. The Icewine Festival has begun in Niagara-on-the-Lake and so far, of the sweet and savory food, this is my favorite nibble. Rich but creamy chocolate ganache with a hint of Icewine in a dark choc

name: The Block Arcade
text: One of the things that distinguishes the city of Melbourne from others around the world, is its laneways. Different from the cafe scenes in Paris or New York, the [essentially] alleys which house coffee shops and bars around Melbourne are away from traffi

name: Palazzo Vecchio
text: Palazzo Vecchio also has a nice view of the rooftops of Florence and the Duomo. What is it about Italian towns that's so alluring...

name: Sultanahmet Cami
text: Most people emphasize the ceiling in the Blue Mosque. After all, it is what gave the Sultanahmet Camii it's popular name. Now that I've finally been, I get it. I did think I was a *little* over-hyped but it's nonetheless something everyone should see if y

name: Le Refuge
text: For our second night in Paris we ended up in the neighborhood of Amélie fame: Montmartre. With @dante8 and @theplanetd I doubly enjoyed the romance of one of the city's most captured neighborhoods. Even though we didn't eat here, this restaurant somehow

name: Split
text: Have you ever drunk water from a spring in the mountains delivered to a fountain in the city via ancient Roman aqueduct? You can at this fountain inside the old walls in Split! Though the face of it is new[ish], the water you can drink after you push the

name: Swilken Bridge
text: Estimated to have been built around 700 years ago, to aid shepherds herding livestock, Swilcan Bridge is a well known landmark of golf and of St. Andrews itself. Most of the sport's biggest celebrities have posed on the bridge or experienced great moments

name: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York
text: \A man's work is nothing but this slow trek to rediscover, through the detours of art, those two or three great and simple images in whose presence his heart first opened.\" -Albert Camus"

name: The Gleneagles Hotel
text: Aside from being luxurious, having excellent food, world class golf and fun activities such as Falconry... @thegleneagleshotel also just looks grand. This is their main restaurant from the tennis courts. I'll miss it.

name: Dubrovnik
text: Gray, rainy introduction to @Zagreb_Croatia but I can't say I mind. We've made it after two flights and a layover and I can't wait to discover this new-to-me country with @bohemiantrails @captainandclark @backpackerbrock. #BlogCroatia

name: Niagara On The Lake Ice Wine Festival
text: This is what it looks like to attend the Niagara-on-the-Lake Icewine Festival. Everyone is bundled up, huddled around open fires when not at a tent and when they are, nibbling on gourmet bites by local chefs who incorporate seasonal produce, pork belly, a

name: Ožujsko PUB \TKALČA\"
text: Searching for our first meal in Zagreb, with glistening streets, the glow of street lamps and the roar of locals watching a futbol match -- took us down a few quaint side streets where we ended up having dessert even before we found a good restaurant. Ahh

name: Château de Versailles
text: The gleaming golden gates of Chateau de Versailles are perhaps the most immediately captivating of its external features. They're also...fake?! Reports conflict somewhat but there definitely was a €4 million restoration done in 2008 which produced the g

name: The Dumbo Loft
text: I love my friends/family in the Midwest but I don't feel at home there. Passed this on my way to the bodega this morning and the smile it put on my face reminded me that this city, NYC - with its grungy glamour and a frenetic energy that can be exhausting

name: Earthy
text: I'll be the first to tell you pubs are a great place to escape Scotland's drab weather, or enjoy a good pint. But today's lunch at Earthy is a really lovely alternative. The restaurant has all the coziness I crave with a fully organic menu of both food an

name: Constance Le Prince Maurice
text: Is it easier to relax in paradise, like that man on the edge of the infinity pool? Or do we just forget how important to a balanced life relaxation is, when we're home and concentrating instead on responsibilities and caught up in the stresses of life...

name: Mange tout Brighton
text: There's a pretty huge bike culture in Brighton. (Would make @duzer proud.) I'm experiencing major bike envy. The most lovely bicycles are everywhere and make me want one of my own. Would probably work well back at home in Astoria! Also - this one leaning

name: Place de la concorde
text:
Site of one of my favorite scenes from \The Devil Wears Prada\" and one of the largest squares or intersections in Paris, Place de la Concorde is stunning even on a day when the sky is overcast and gray. The gold and green simply shines, even in \"bad\"
 417352064857220475_116480"

name: Hale & Hearty Soups
text: Some rough news this afternoon, enough to ruin a day if I didn't have someone like @dante8 to share life with. Then I looked up and saw spring making itself known and between the two I realized that it's all in our attitude. Happiness is a choice and hope

name: Central Park The Pond
text: #latergram dreams of adventures by The Pond \|\| stuck indoors feeling unwell & saddled with writing deadlines today \|\| I'd rather be strolling the paths of Central Park, taking naps on the green...

name: Rockefeller Center

name: Basilica di San Petronio
text: Bikes, mopeds and Vespas are everywhere in Bologna. With the narrow streets, converted from canals, it's not surprising. It is also yet another place that makes me long for a bike of my own. It's environmentally friendly and it's good for your health, wha

name: Shaw Club Hotel And Spa
text: Snow is softly falling outside, I have toe warmers in my boots and this frittata with goat cheese, bacon, arugula and mushrooms is preparing me for a long day of Icewine tasting in Niagara-on-the-Lake in @winecountryont.

name: Joe's Ginger Corp
text:
Chinatown, while one of the most vibrant neighborhoods in NYC, can be exhausting and overwhelming. Also, it's so saturated that it can be difficult to find the real gems without a guide. \
 I recommend,\
 1) Ahoy NYC Food Tours, \
 2) the Chinatown Chow Down

name: Candi Borobudur/Borobudur Temple

name: Gaumont Marignan
text:
The last time I visited Paris, I did a photo essay showcasing doors and door knobs and all manner of bits and bobs to do with entryways....I think there's gonna need to be a Part Deux. \
 Paris = Constant. Door. Porn.

name: Isham
text: What's to dislike about an English village that still has thatch-roof cottages and red telephone booths... But work calls. My rest period is over & tomorrow I'll be swapping cliché country lanes for the graffiti-laden streets of Berlin. A one month tour

name: Place Blanche

text: I've been in a lot of churches and cathedrals in my lifetime. This week I was in the highly acclaimed, Hagia Sophia. NOTHING, for me, compares to the inside of Notre-Dame de la Garde. It's a matter of personal taste of course but the maritime and animal t

name: Les Notaires Du Quai Voltaire
text: The Seine has been described as the \only river that runs between two bookshelves\" because of the Bouquinistes that line both the right and left bank. A Paris fixture since the mid-1500s, they received official permission to operate permanently in 1891.

name: John F. Kennedy International Airport
text: Traveling today for the first time with @AirBerlin (and my dear friends @carolacain @landlopers). I haven't truly been on a trip in, for me, a while now. So I'm feeling an elevated level of excitement at what will come. I'll be traveling to Berlin and Lei

name: National Museums Scotland
text: I don't normally post more than one or two images from a single place or about one thing but I loved National Museum of Scotland so much I had to share this one as well. The exhibits are so wide ranging and displayed in such a fun way. It's just an extrao

name: Station Sherbrooke
text: I knew about the purple ceiling of Montréal's Sherbrooke Metro station long before I even knew I was going to get to visit the city. Was I fated to have this be the closest station to my hotel? Maybe. Maybe the things we wish for, we really can will into

name: The Gleneagles Hotel

text: Dutch artist, Florentijn Hofman created this 15-metre high yellow Rubber Duck that can currently be seen in Darling Harbour. I'm so glad I arrived in Sydney for my #SeeAustralia tour in time to see it before it leaves for its next port-of-call on 23 Janua

text: Saturday afternoon at the MET funsies with @dante8. I love his black and white photograph of the long expanse of glass in the Temple of Dendur yet I was drawn to these two statues which guard the entrance. Check out kirstenalana.tumblr.com for more from t

name: Kamenita vrata

text: Watching the sun rise from Cadillac Mountain in Maine is seeing its rays before anyone else in the USA does, during fall and winter. That makes it a pretty popular activity on cold mornings when the wind will knock you down and take your breath away. But

name: St Andrews Cathedral

name: Union Square Greenmarket

text: Just at the corner of Palazzo Vecchio is the Fountain of Neptune which was commissioned in 1565 and was created by sculptor Bartolomeo Ammannati to commemorate the wedding of Francesco I de'Medici and Joanna of Austria, the Grand Duchess. In the sixteenth

name: Fort Saint Jean
text: Marseille won't be my favorite city in France, for many reasons. But in this brief moment, as this wooden sailing vessel came into port around the corner of Fort Saint-Jean, and just a bit of light broke through the heavy cloud cover -- for just a moment,

name: The Manhattan Club
text: Went in search of more facades for my #WinterStorefront series and stumbled across this scene. Seems like the holidays are zooming by as fast as this cab did and already tomorrow I leave for Scotland where I'll be bidding farewell to 2013 at @edhogmanay.

text: In the normally quiet town of Queensferry, New Year's Day becomes a riot of more than a thousand costumed loony dookers who come to swim in the Firth of Forth. Thousands more come to watch and marvel at the courage of those who endure the freezing water.

name: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York
text: I'm a huge geek for museums, and it was in the @metmuseum for the first time that I really decided I wanted to live in NYC. Taking my mom there this week, during her first visit to see me here in my now-home, I realized the spark is still there. So, @nyon

name: Four Seasons Hotel Toronto
text: What you can't see, to my right and your left, is gently falling snow and the lights of Toronto on display in those floor to ceiling windows. I'm so in love with my whole suite at @fstoronto. Can I just move in?

text: Loch Ard Gorge along the @GreatOceanRoad is named for the ship, 'Loch Ard' which sank just off the coast of Victoria in 1878 -- emptying its only two survivors onto this stretch of coast. Coincidentally, the ship was named for a lake in Scotland where I b

text: I look at food in so many ways and this meal was the chance to \break bread\" with two dear friends before a full day of adventuring: @maurice and @mevallieres. Neither knew each other before our meal and only had me in common but now they're connected.

text: Is it #ChryslerMonday yet? I'm sad to see the weekend end but happy I got to see Manhattan looking so mighty fine tonight as it bid adieu to another day.

name: Porsche Werk Leipzig
text: I've left Berlin to attend #STSLeipzig but before any conference classes could begin, we had to visit @Porsche Werk Leipzig where 40,000 people per year come to see the 4-door Panamera, Macan and Cayenne in final production. I can't share photos from the

name: Barbershop
text: Second installment in my #WinterStorefront series. I love how the door makes me think of candy canes at this time of year even though it's like that every day. Hipster bonus points for the bicycle? //\\\\ Tag your holiday storefront finds and I'll feature

name: Washington Square Park
text: I think @Gerry_Badell agrees this weather is for the birds... 😉 Great to meet him and so many others at #WinterWalkNYC. Thanks for organizing @dave_krugman @sittingingodspalm @jnsilva @kevin_ornelas!

name: Lotte New York Palace
text: What's that NYC? You're jealous I'm posting pics of Toronto and you're wishing I'd show off your gorgeous winter white snow coat? Oh, ok.... #polarvortex

text: #FriFotos theme, luxe, has me wishing for a few more days at @ConstanceHotels Le PrinceMaurice with @peterparkorr @luxurytravelmom and @foodandthefab. The videos from our trip are finally live so head on over to see what #UltimateMauritius is all about: b

name: Barrio Queen
text: I've been eagerly awaiting the taste of the tacos at @BarrioQueen since long before I came to Scottsdale. They were more than worth the wait!! As was the Horchata, black bean dip, Victoria beer, Churros and Flan. I could wax poetic about the food for a lo

name: Scottish National Portrait Gallery
text: I want to visit more museums in 2014, I always feel like I'm coming home when I enter a good one. Here I am in a sort of #EmptyMET moment at the National Gallery of Scotland in @weloveedinburgh and when I think of bucket list moments, for the rest of my l

name: Bo Kaap
text: I've heard about and seen photos of Bo-kaap for a very long time and while it was every bit as colorful as I expected it to be, it was also difficult to photograph because of what time we arrived this morning, the narrow streets and the plethora of power

name: Champ De Mars
text: Montréal has a very extensive underground city of tunnels, passageways and metro stations. They're a delight because they all feature artwork of some kind or a cool architectural feature that makes them very photographable. (And in the winter, they keep

name: D'Ouwe Werf Hotel Stellenbosch
text: This is just a small sample of how cool and eclectic the inside of Oude Werf Hotel in Stellenbosch is, South Africa's oldest inn. Completely redone recently, I have read it was difficult to maintain the architectural integrity of such an old structure whi

name: Constance Le Prince Maurice
text: I can't get over the color here in Mauritius at @ConstanceHotels Le Prince Maurice. It's as if someone read my diary and created a place that includes every shade of my favorite pinks, blues, greens, and shades of orange...

name: New York Public Library
text: I made a date with the @NYPL today since I had a meeting nearby. The Schwarzman Building is one of my favorite architectural landmarks in NYC but whereas most people go in the main entrance, I like to sneak in the side. That's where I can see my other fav

name: Pink Tartan
text: Yet another #latergram from my Toronto adventure! I adore this building in Yorkville that was a jail way way back in the day but now houses the flagship boutique of @Pink_Tartan. Designer Kimberley Newport-Mimran also created the uniforms for @PorterAirli

name: Four & Twenty Blackbirds
text: #latergram from a lovely afternoon at @BirdsBlack ... spiced pumpkin pie and English tea with milk + a great travel read

name: Marché Jean-Talon
text: Spotted these beauties at Marché Jean-Talon on my tour of Montréal with @eatdrinkbcarrie. Let's just they were not the only thing I began obsessively snapping with my #Qx100. I think I could do a whole photo book with just pictures of markets and fresh

name: Camping Vall de Ribes
text: Took this on a beautiful walk through the Pyrenees in Spain. To remember that day makes me think of this quote: \Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.\" - Thích Nhãt Hanh"

name: The Cloisters
text: I'm resurrecting @karaforth's hashtag to post a #LoversCollab between @dante8 & I. This is his shot of me, my edit using @vsco. I love the thought behind Kara's hashtag and I think it's a sweet idea for couples who each have their own accounts here on Ins

name: Centre-ville
text: Old Montréal occupies the plot of land where the city began, with exchanges between natives and fur traders early in the 1600s and where later French settlers established Ville-Marie, the eventual city of Montréal. After extensive fires laid waste to al

name: Le Royal Monceau
text: I've been in search of a very photographable staircase for some time now and the Philippe Starck-designed @leroyalmonceau is just the muse I've been dreaming of. Mike Tyson is lounging at the bar and we're off to enjoy their legendary brunch after our tou

name: Lanzerac Hotel & Spa
text: The village of Stellenbosch is ringed by mountains and the way into Lanzerac is down a long oak tree-lined drive with vineyards and mountain peaks beyond the boughs of the giant trees. The physical beauty of Africa is already making my heart ache a little

name: University Place
text: Every day in NYC represents the chance to meet new people and make new friends. It's a city overflowing with people and I always wonder about all their stories. Well, @sionfullana needs your help to tell some of those stories on the new site, Beacon. Beca

name: Howies Victoria Street
text: It seems every time I'm in Edinburgh, I happen to walk up or down Victoria Street in the Old Town at least once a day. Which is fine because I never tire of doing so. It's also very close to all my favorite pubs in the city. And a long evening in an Edinb

name: Siège Galeries Lafayette
text: There is much to see from the roof of @galerieslafayette but the real draw is inside where architectural gems such as this Neo-Byzantine dome, built in 1912, make the store the second most visited attraction in Paris after la Louvre. #FrancePassion

name: MTA Subway - Brooklyn Bridge City Hall Station (4) (5) (6) (J) (Z)
text: Current state of weather affairs in NYC. I've never wanted to move to an island paradise more than I want to today.

name: MTA - 53rd & Lexington; E M 6
text: \Wherever my story takes me, however dark and difficult the theme, there is always some hope and redemption, not because readers like happy endings, but because I am an optimist at heart. I know the sun will rise in the morning, that there is a light at t

name: The Cloisters
text: The dear @brittreints reminded me last week how sad it is to always wish I was somewhere else and yet I keep wishing it this winter. I like to take pictures in the snow but I'm not happy in winter. I neeeeeed the sun and warm temperatures in my life. Does

name: Stirling Castle
text: Happy New Year from Stirling Castle, in @visitscotland! The Scottish singer-songwriter Dougie MacLean sang my favorite tune of the night, 'Caledonia' and I couldn't help but feel the Deep Scottish Love get the best of me for a moment. This is definitely a

name: The Cloisters
text: There are actually two cloisters in the @MetMuseum's Cloisters. (My previous photo showed the museum's chapel.) The term refers to what is basically a courtyard or garden ringed with columns which are surrounded by a covered walkway, usually part of a mon

name: Jane's Carousel
text: Wanderlust has been killing me lately but @dante8 helps to keep me grounded. I love our weekend photo adventures and what a great day it was for one today: 50F and clear, blue skies!!

name: Bryant Park
text: I'm a huge fan of Scotland, after two trips, it has firmly cemented itself into my \favorite countries\" list. So when I found out that a little bit of Scotland was coming to NYC, I had to go and see. The equine sculpture shown here is one of two current

name: Spier Wine Farm
text: Tonight's communal dinner at @spierwinefarm was imaginatively orchestrated by Marije Vogelzang and took place in three different parts of the working winery. Beginning with a paper-wrapped package of food in shells (nuts, quail eggs etc), continuing on to

name: Platja de Castell
text: I'm all for appreciating where I am. Yet if I could, I'd carry my love and I away to @costabravapirineu for Valentine's Day. It's definitely a place I love that I'd like to share with him. // If you could be anywhere in the world today, where would you be

name: Mauboussin
text: Number three in my #WinterStorefront series is a latergram from Paris and our visit to @mauboussinny's flagship store in the Place Vendôme. The city looked so beautiful decorated for the holidays even though there wasn't the snow that I came home to in N

name: Terrasse des Galeries Lafayettes
text: Pro tip: the best free view of Paris is from the outdoor terrace level of @galerieslafayette. This is but a fraction of what you can see and the bonus is that during winter, there's a pop up café. #FrancePassion

name: New York Public Library
text: Lazy afternoons between appointments at the @NYPL Schwarzman Building. Might have to make it a regular thing and purposely plan extra time between meetings...

name: Spier Wine Farm
text: All over the @spierwinefarm property are Coral Trees. Their beautiful green leaves and bright ruby \flowers\" are such a stunning sight against the cobalt sky. The Afrikaans name, 'Kanniedood Boom', translates to Immortal Tree and in Zulu culture when a

name: Wnyc Transmitter Park
text: Yesterday I had the privilege of going on a photo walk with my old friend @jordan_miles because of my role as Community Manager for @instagramnyc. (One of the hats I wear here in NYC when I'm not traveling.) I asked @iamtomchang to take this photo of me t

name: The Promenade On Roosevelt Island
text: Can't believe it took me so long but I've finally been to Roosevelt Island. Situated in the middle of the East River, under the Queensboro Bridge (named for our former President FDR but once called Welfare Island) it's serviced by only a tram + one subway

text: Last night's Negroni by @jeffmorgen at @clydecommon was delicious but when I found out he recently had time to author 'The Bar Book' AND open an underground Speakeasy, all while still doing his job at Clyde Common, I had to follow the cocktail trail furth

name: Free People
text: Number Four in my #WinterStorefront series is this festive @FreePeople window from down in SoHo. I loved that even though it wasn't snowing, the window seemed plenty festive on its own. All I had to do was wait and get some blur from a passerby which I al

name: Brooklyn Brigde Park
text: A world nearly devoid of color. Until a girl with a red umbrella walks into it...

name: Neues Museum
text: The Neues Museum was closed in 1939 at the beginning of WWII, heavily damaged during the bombing of Berlin and then left to crumble into ruin until architect David Chipperfield was hired to rebuild and reopen it in the 2000's. Officially it reopened in 20

name: Royal Arcade
text: Ever since my earlier #latergram from Australia, I've been thinking back on my wonderful trip from one year ago. This is a Melbourne laneway and if you find yourself in the city you should contact @fsweetman for the best laneway tour in the city. She'll t

name: Taliesin West, Arizona
text: For Frank Lloyd Wright, Taliesin West was a place where he could experiment and innovate; a place he could try things that were never possible with client commissions. Interior gutter systems, canvas roofing, and colorful details that commercial and resid

name: On the Top Table Mountain, Cape Town
text: In case there was any doubt in your mind, as to whether or not the view from Table Mountain in Cape Town is worth the effort and money....I had tears in my eyes as this photo was being taken. And it is an effort. Table Mountain has become a number one att

name: Fly Cape Town Paragliding
text: Next to Table Mountain, Signal Hill and Lion's Head are peaks with walking trails, lookout points and stunning views of Cape Town and it's surrounding suburbs. My favorite part of exploring them both, was watching the paragliders take off from Signal Hill

name: Constance Le Prince Maurice
text: \Utility is when you have one telephone, luxury is when you have two, opulence is when you have three - and paradise is when you have none.\" -Doug Larson"

name: Hotel deLuxe
text: Up on the roof of Portland's @hotel_deluxe, where on a clear day you can see all the way to the snowcapped mountains, Damian of @beelocal is checking up on his bees. It's Nectar Flow time and when you reach in and [very] carefully swipe a little honey fro

name: Literary Walk in Central Park
text: This city is a lovely place to visit but a hard place to make a life. So when I'm most down in the dumps, I try to go to one of my favorite places, to remember why I first fell in love with this place and to connect to why I still love it, when I force my

name: Brooklyn Brigde Park
text: If the ghost of the Brooklyn Bridge didn't give it away, I could almost imagine I'm back in Paris, or I've found my way to Prague or Moscow. Love locks everywhere these days.

name: Aceta Lokanta
text: I do not even know where to begin, to catch up to the other bloggers who have had WiFi or cell service during our visit to Berlin. I've had none so I'm probably 50 photos behind. But I can tell you I've had one of the best days touring a city of any trip

name: BMW Performance Center
text:
What’s a more natural high than even the best cup of coffee and a bigger boost to self esteem than any award or compliment? Confidence, that comes from within!!\
 .\
 Real talk: It’s not something that comes easy to me. I’ve dealt with poor self estee

name: Yorkville
text: Yorkville, once just a village outside of Toronto, is now one of the city's most interesting and vibrant areas. From the high end shopping on Bloor Street to the historic homes on side streets which maintain their character because of preservation laws...

name: Jane's Carousel
text: Arrived home just in time for the @Instagram #WWIM8 #NicheInstameet in NYC. Foggy, atmospheric day for photos!

name: Food Carts
text: A long evening and a long morning of travel made me a hungry lady so my first stop in @travelportland had to be the food carts at Alder between 9th and 10th. Funny story: I was strolling the line up of carts trying to decide what I wanted, spotted @BentoB

name: BREWVANA Portland Through Craft
text: I might get in trouble for posting this one but I sure hope not. I chose it because of that pretty lady there on the left, see her? Smiling and laughing? Well that's Ashley Rose. She's the big chief at @Brewvana Beer Tours and she is one of the most passi

name: Flatiron District, NYC
text: Walked out of @mmlnyc with @takinyerphoto and had every intention of ducking back inside to escape the cold somewhere before my evening event but then I couldn't resist the last light in Flatiron. I love that just a few weeks ago it would have been dark a

name: Mount Nelson Hotel
text: This is just one of the incredible courses we had at Mount Nelson Hotel, prepared by @CheslinChef with the ingredients he and Charlie showed us how to forage in Cape Town. I've been blessed by some incredible culinary experiences in my life but this (alon

name: Red Hook
text: I have an obsession. It involves taking a lot of photos of doors in every country I visit. And even in NYC. Now I've discovered there's a #Doortraits hashtag !!!!!!!!! Prepare yourself for more door porn...

name: Pergamonmuseum
text: Since I was a very young girl I've dreamed of seeing The Ishtar Gate (Arabic: بوابة عشتار‎). Seeing photos of its blue tiles and animal mosaics wasn't enough for me in books alone, I wanted to see the real thing because I couldn't believe some

name: Four Seasons Resort Scottsdale at Troon North
text: When you visit @FSscottsdale this summer, ask for bartender Steven and have him make you his \Summer Getaway\", or (pictured here) the \"Salted Melon Mojito.\" The man knows his cocktails!! A perfect way to spend golden hour in the hills above Scottsda

text: It feels hot as hades in our NYC apartment and I wish I was back in the pool at @wfortlauderdale, cooling off in style. It is cleverly designed to go over and around the stairway entrance to the pool deck so that when you emerge from one floor onto the ne

name: Taliesin West, Arizona
text: I became enamored of the works of American architect Frank Lloyd Wright (1867-1959) at a very young age, so a visit to his Taliesin West was more than 2 decades in the making and it did not disappoint. Like the name suggests, it is one of two places given

name: Steak 954
text: In terms of hotels I've stayed at recently, there have been a lot of home runs and a couple of big misses, but @WFortLauderdale hit every note pitch perfect from beginning to end. One of the big highlights was dining at Steak954 for breakfast and dinner.

name: Ox Restaurant
text: It would be entirely too difficult to choose a favorite food or drink experience from my time in Portland, Oregon. Thanks to @travelportland, I was able to experience some of the best of the best. Here are my top recommendations culled from the sum of all

text: Starting Day 2 of my @skyscanner Takeover in Astoria with a #DailyCortado at my favorite gastropub @TheQueensKickshaw. I'll be bringing you a few more Hidden Gems from Queens today but only on the @skyscanner account so you'll just have to follow them and

name: The Arts District
text: I haven't been here long, in LA, and I never like to presume I know a place when I'm only visiting. That being said, my impression of Los Angeles is that it's a place with many layers, like this street art I discovered. I think that it is diverse, hard at

name: Sunrise Paddleboards
text: I have a paralyzing fear that I don't talk about often, mainly because I like to [try and] focus on the positive. However, I am terribly afraid of dark water and bodies of water that are any color which prohibit me from seeing all the way to the bottom, n

name: Green Parrot, Key West, Florida
text: The Green Parrot is my favorite bar in Key West. It's also beloved by local David Sloan, a serial entrepreneur who is so engaging I could have spent all day listening to his stories. He started Key West's first ghost tour and has since sold it, he's writt

name: Anna Blume
text: While I'm traveling through Germany (with limited WiFi) I've just found out that @huffpost_arts included me in a list of recommended Instagrammers and I'm floored at the spike in followers that has caused. If you're new around here, welcome, and thank you

name: MaMa Florence
text: On Facebook I introduced this trip to Roma & Firenze with @xoalitalia as the maker and creator tour of Italy. It could have also been the tour where there was one great culinary experience after another to the point where when I began the journey home, I

name: Bath House Studio
text: I've left my hectic freelance day job life behind and entered an Italian rooftop paradise tonight thanks to @SanPellegrino_Official. Chef @mvoltaggio is in the kitchen, Fellini movies are projected on the wall behind our heads, twinkle lights punctuate th

name: Fort Lauderdale Water Taxi
text: It's easy to get around @visitlauderdale since they, like so many cities, now have a bike share program and taxis are plentiful but I opted for the Water Taxi because I wanted to see why Ft. Lauderdale is known as the \Venice of America.\" With more than

name: Bruce Park Greenwich Ct
text: It might not be as exotic as the rice fields of Bali or as exciting as the nightlife in Miami or even as delicious as the food in Portland and Scottsdale (all recent travels of mine) but I gotta tell you that coming back home to an invitation from @SheBuy

name: Viceroy Santa Monica
text: From the moody morning fog of Malibu to the boutique sophistication of @viceroysm, we're really getting around SoCal today. A little cabana + pool time and then it's off to meet some of my very favorite California residents...

name: Singh Farms
text: Getting to know Ken while at Singh Farms was a true blessing but going even further and being able to taste his ready made pizzas, corn-on-the-cob, tamales and fresh pressed juice kind of blew my mind. I thought I had tasted \fresh\" food before but the

name: Barrio Queen
text: Before I left @scottsdalecvb, on a walk around the Old Town, I found myself passing @BarrioQueen and a pull like a magnet brought me inside for a second round of tacos. They're so good I see this happening from across the country. So that's definitely a t

name: Augustusplatz
text: During today's sessions of #STSleipzig, @smaracuja & @esctown gave a great talk on how brands should be using Instagram, in which they reminded me of one of my favorite hashtags that I haven't used in a while: #fromwhereistand. So I promptly went out with

name: The Mulia , Mulia Resort & Villas - Nusa Dua , Bali
text: It was difficult to get out of this bed @themuliabali, I don't know if you can tell but it's one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in! I love the mirror over the bed and the color of the lamp as well. Tempting to want to bring those elements in

name: Culina
text: After a packed day of sightseeing again in LA (and enduring the heavy traffic), drinks at the @fslosangeles with @luxehotelier & @dante8 is like some kind balm for the soul. Danté and I have been on a bit of a Bloody Mary kick and unsurprisingly it's a h

name: Microsoft Building 92
text: Travel and photography are my first loves but I also geek out pretty hard core over technology and lately that passion has led me to some pretty cool places; like Microsoft Headquarters in Redmond, Washington -- where I've been all day. It's a fascinating

name: FAT Village Arts District
text: I can't even describe to you in less than a blog post just how inspiring and actually unique (literally one of a kind in terms of anywhere I've yet been) @FatVillage in @visitlauderdale is but I'm gonna share two photos so you at least get an idea. There

name: Clyde Common
text: After a day of going behind-the-scenes at both @StumptownCoffee and @SaltAndStraw, it's only fitting to be enjoying the long shadows of golden hour while sipping on a Negroni made my @JeffMorgen at @clydecommon while a #ZombieCar passes by outside. Right?

name: Four Seasons Resort Scottsdale at Troon North
text: After all of the unusual architecture I've seen on this visit to @scottsdalecvb, it was nice to take a road trip up into the hills to visit @fsscottsdale which is a serene escape and a nice contrast to downtown. The hotel's traditional southwestern buildi

name: Hogfish Bar & Grill
text: Made it to Florida where the first order of business is filling my belly. We're on Stock Island at local favorite (and a truly hidden gem in that it's hard to find): Hogfish Bar & Grill. It's on the water and has an extensive art collection. These are the

name: Four Seasons Hotel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills
text: Soo many great moments during our stay at @fslosangeles but I had to share this one that @dante8 captured because it kind of sums up everything. We've felt at home here in LA but no matter where I go, I always love reading the NY Times. And I gotta have a

name: Himmarshee Public House
text: Left Miami for @visitlauderdale and I just had the most AMAZING lunch at @PublicHouseFTL. The World Cup game was playing in the background as I indulged in a Florida craft beer, plus Chicken Tacos, Spicy Empanadas, a fresh salad and the STAR of the meal:

name: Michelle Nicole Lowe Art
text: We met so many incredible locals in the Keys that I could never pick a favorite but I was particularly blown away by @michellenicolelowe because her watercolor artworks reminded me of my own mother's watercolors from when I was a girl and because Michelle

name: The Commons Brewery
text: I loved some aspect of every brewery we visited on our @brewvana tour but there was something about @CommonsBrewery that I really connected to and I think that was their motto which is, \Gather Around Beer.\" It's a very serene place, unlike other brewer

name: El Matador State Beach
text: We've traded desert sand for beach sand and Arizona for California! I've only been to the northern half of this state and @dante8 used to work in LA so he's gonna play tour guide and show me around! Had to begin with a morning excursion through the fog of

name: Denkmal für die ermordeten Juden Europas
text: Another sobering place in Berlin, the Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe, designed by Peter Eisenman. There I could not think of anything but this quote: \Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only lo

name: Sanctuary on Camelback Mountain Resort and Spa
text: I'm not sure of the wisdom of coming here right after a lunch of cheese, bread and wine, but.....I couldn't resist when I saw a sneak peek of the pool on @sanctuaryaz_'s feed. I might have ran here. So at least I got a little workout in before my plunge!

name: Fontainebleau Resort Miami Beach Poolside
text: There are a lot of reasons to love the elegant @fontainebleau here in Miami Beach but since I'm a huge design nerd, my favorite thing is the architecture and decorative details. This is the entryway which I traversed to enter the hotel and I fell in love

text: One of the downsides of a travel-filled life like mine is that it can really take a toll on the body. And it has, on mine. So yesterday I started my first ever juice cleanse thanks to the super cool people @lovegracefoods (and especially @jimmythegreengia

name: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
text:
🥑 toast start to the week. Let’s do this!\
 .\
 There’s so much of my life now that I wouldn’t want to change, so much of who I am today, that I owe to travel. Probably chief amongst those, and my family can attest to this, is that I used to be a r

name: Pigeon Key
text: This is the underside of Old 7 Mile Bridge as seen from Pigeon Key. Once a home for the workers who built the bridge, then a retreat for a while, semi abandoned after a time....it's now being carefully preserved and restored just like the bridge itself. P

name: Space Needle
text: I like to portray places as often as I can in ways which are slightly unexpected so usually I don't go heavy on landmarks and famous sites. In that vein, I wasn't going to post a photo of Seattle's Space Needle. But then I arrived in town and immediately

name: Landgericht Leipzig
text: I'll leave without seeing quite as much of Germany's music city as I would have liked to, but one thing I did get to experience was golden hour, literally. The way some of Leipzig's yellow buildings come alive in the long light at the end of the day, just

text: Most of my photos from Bali have no one in them because I was alone a lot, but the happiest moments were spent getting to know @jamlynnsig, @jonescrow & @peaceloveshea. There's just something about exploring with other people that adds a dimension to trav

name: Fontainebleau Miami Beach
text: The @fontainebleau Miami Beach debuted in 1954 with an event so grand it counted amongst its guests the mayor of Fontainebleau, France. While the hotel has underdone renovation and restoration since the year it set the gold standard in luxury for Miami ho

name: International Rose Test Garden
text: Portland is known as the \City of Roses\" and it has an enormous International Rose Test Garden on a slope above downtown. It is the oldest continuously operating public rose test garden in the USA with over 7,000 plants of approximately 550 varieties. T

name: Ne Alberta

text: Another one of my favorite spots in @visitlauderdale: @sweetnectarbuzz. They have a special grill that I swear somehow makes their grilled meat, fish and vegetables taste better than any I've ever had anywhere else. Pair that with a delightful outdoor din

name: Cosanti
text: We visited a place here in Scottsdale that I'm not even sure I can describe: Cosanti, the gallery, studio and residence of Italian-American architect and artist Paolo Soleri. He recently passed away and now the site is managed by two wonderful people who

name: Eastbank Esplanade
text: I always love seeing a city by bicycle and today I got to @travelportland by bike with @cyclepdx. It was a gorgeous day, Guthrie (my guide) was the trifecta of funny + informative + cute and I loved seeing so many much of what makes Portland great all in

name: Soleil at Mulia Bali
text: Now this is more like it! Starting my first full day in Bali with Sunday Brunch @themuliabali in Soleil which is their Mediterranean/Pan Asian restaurant close to the ocean and next to the main pool. It's a beautiful airy space that's finally helping me t

name: Four Seasons Resort Scottsdale at Troon North
text: I couldn't visit Arizona and not post a photo of a Saguaro Cactus. It's native to the Sonoran Desert, can grow to be over 70 feet (20m) tall and may not even grow its first arm before reaching 75-100 years of age. Some live for more than 150 years. I love

name: Oddfellows Cafe & Bar
text: I've come to Seattle to get my geek on with @nokiaus and they know me so well. We're starting out our adventure with brunch at @OddFellowsCafe in Capitol Hill. Eating is usually one of my first priorities and especially at places that are so photographabl

name: Islamorada Library Park
text: Locals in the Keys use motorized and non-motorized watercraft to get almost everywhere. Forget cars! So today we're hanging out with Sara Michael, assistant manager of @budnmarysmarina, exploring the Bay by paddleboard. The best part about it is being so

name: NJ turnpike
text: This? Just a perfect sky and the perfect temperature for a road trip with the windows down. Washington D.C. --> NYC. Homeward bound.

name: The Mulia, Mulia Resort & Villas, Bali
text: This pool at @themuliabali is another one of my favorite spots on the resort. It's actually an outdoor hot/cold jacuzzi-style pool attached to the Mulia Spa. The perfect place to relax after you've....well, relaxed! But the best part of the spa is inside,

name: Key West, Florida 33040
text: Rick Worth moved to Key West in the 80's and quickly became of the town's most beloved artists. One of the things he's known for is painting cars. Worth has adorned cars with depictions of everything from sharks to toucans to lifelike reefs and elaborate

name: Indian Canyons, Palm Springs
text:

text: From rustic-but-peaceful Big Sur we hightailed it down to LA where I've got a family wedding to attend and work coming up with Microsoft! @dante8 is with me for a few days before he has to get back to NYC (sad face) and he took this photo of me in an outf

name: AuBreve Espresso
text: What simple pleasures do you enjoy when you have spare time for yourself? I never carve out such time during a work day but today I really needed to for so many reasons ... so I stopped, and chose to read the NY Times in print while drinking a Flat White

name: Blue Heaven
text: Key Lime Pie might be Key West's most famous export. It's also a bit debated around town. Who makes the best? Should it be topped with meringue or whipped cream? Not topped at all? Where was it first made? Who invented it in the first place? Local histori

name: Sanctuary on Camelback Mountain Resort and Spa
text: I've barely been in Arizona a hot minute, and I do mean hot (105 F !!!!), but already @sanctuaryaz_ is making sure I'm comfortable and well taken care of. Every staff member I have met has exceeded my high expectations and just when I was thinking I neede

name: Four Seasons Hotel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills
text: Because I've been so busy during this trip to LA, my images have been mostly latergrams. (Which I hate doing but couldn't help this time.) Since I decided to slow down today, I figured I'd show you an in-the-moment photo and also state my commitment to th

text: So it's #NationalDonutDay and even though I said I was going to do other things besides eat here in Portland, I've got a foodie inside me that always fighting for control so as soon as she saw the words \National Donut Day,\" she demanded being fed. Then

text: The @KhongRiverHouse in downtown Miami Beach draws its name from the Mekong River which flows through Myanmar, Laos, Thailand, Cambodia and Vietnam. It's an excellently designed restaurant with an ever changing menu that focuses on bringing the flavors of

name: The High Line
text: Tonight I joined my @walksofnewyork colleagues for a free guided tour with Friends of the @highlinenyc. They take place at 6:30 PM every Tuesday, May through September, weather permitting, and they're such a great way to learn about one of the city's true

name: Fontainebleau Miami Beach
text: Beyond the old, preserved, details at @fontainebleau there are great new design and architectural elements that I really loved and in particular these huge mirrors that line the hallways where the guest rooms are. I thought I'd use them to capture a rare

name: The Keys
text: Another Key West local that's a must know, not unlike David Sloan, is Paul Menta. Pro kiteboarder, chef, mixologist, etc etc and now the owner of the first legal rum distillery in the Keys; appropriately named: Legal Rum Distillery. Paul's rum is incredib

name: Alchemy
text: I've been very impressed with the food at @themuliabali and there's not really a need to eat off-resort but since I love to eat so much I can't really take a trip somewhere without scoping the local culinary scene. After doing the painstaking, yumgasmic r

text: Happy Hour at a Farmer's Market? That's what locals @spencerspellman, @vagabond3 and @travelswithtwo suggested @dante8 and I do last night and it was a blast. The Original Farmer's Market is a historical landmark in LA located at 3rd & Fairfax since Jul

name: Paris, France
text:
Happy Valentine’s Day! Just a little pop of red from the city of love for you.\
 .\
 And when I say “city of love”, I don’t just mean romantic. It was the site of the biggest trip I ever took for self love, it’s been a place for family love and of

name: New York Harbor
text: As a New York resident, the hustle/bustle/concrete/steel aspect of the city that excites so many other people often gets me down. It's then that I need to search out the quieter places, the green spaces and the ways I can get off dry land to get a little

name: Storm King Art Center
text: Spent today #ChasingLight at @StormKingArtCenter before attending a Film Ramble at the Center put on by @rooftopfilms. My love @dante.vincent managed to capture one of my favorite photos ever taken of me and I was reminded of just how much I love to plan

name: Tacos Por Favor Santa Monica
text: Arrived back in NYC just in time to photograph @nytravfest but I'm reallllllllly missing LA. Our last meal had to be tacos and we stumbled upon this place called \Tacos Por Favor\" that didn't let us down. I had tacos al pastor and a second helping of th

name: Beachwood Cafe
text: Less than a week to go before @thetravelcouple heads to California for the second time this year. I'm looking forward to this trip because there will be so much time to just discover and savor....which is how @dante8 and I found @BeachwoodCafeHollywood la

name: Taliesen West

name: Key West, Florida 33040
text: Key West has a great mix of architecture to shoot. It's the kind of place that really makes me happy as a photographer. While this building is just a store and doesn't hold any particular significance according to the locals that I asked (if you are one a

name: Brooklyn Brigde Park
text: So loved officially being a part of #wwim8 for a bit but crowds can become too much for me so I broke away with @dante8 and we both marveled at just how hidden Manhattan was in today's fog. It was like Brooklyn was it's own city again, far away and apart.

name: Williamsburg Waterfront Piers
text: For a long time I've been trying to figure out how I could use my career to help other people more, beyond showing people the world I get to see when I travel, I'd like to actually give the gift of travel. So far that hasn't been possible. So instead I do

text: Been a little quiet because I'm in the midst of planning for the next big adventure. It will be 3 trips in one, all California exploration. (This is from our last trip to CA, where @dante8 and I stayed at the Mission Inn.) If you're a property, brand or b

name: Hotel Valley Ho
text: Looking directly at where the sun is actually setting during sunset is the classic way to capture a colorful sky. But I also love to look in the opposite direction sometimes, where the color might be softer and less vibrant but where the land is bathed in

name: Bath House Studio
text: Chef @mvoltaggio told a story tonight about how, when he was a rookie chef, he used to borrow [take] San Pellegrino from the stockpile of the kitchens he worked in, to drink for himself. He marveled at the fact that he no longer needs to do that. Now, SP

name: Hotel Valley Ho
text: The @hotelvalleyho is a Mid Century Modern gem of a hotel that recently underwent an extensive renovation to take it back to its former glory but to also elevate it to the status it enjoyed when first opened in 1956 which was as THE place for celebrities

name: The Ritz-Carlton, San Francisco
text: Our trip to California did not start out well because of our awful flights and then our lost baggage. But staying @TheRitzCarlton San Francisco was like walking into the warm embrace of a friend or relative. It was so luxurious and comforting and we were

name: Cape Otway Ecolodge

text: If you are in NYC and you love Antiques Shopping, the area around Metropolitan Ave between Driggs and Roebling in Williamsburg is a paradise of options. I counted no less than four great stores in a span of two blocks. I don't know how they all stay in bu

name: National Park Plitvicka Jezera
text: So we've stopped at Plitvice National Park on the way to Opatija and it turns out.....it doesn't suck.

name: Hamilton's
text: Fulfilled my promise and returned to @HamiltonSoda with @dante8 last night. This time I tried the Black Cow, we split fries (they're sooo good) and he had their Egg Cream. I can't believe there isn't yet a line out the door but I fear there soon will be.

name: Culina
text: Speaking of where to eat in LA, I must not leave out my home of the last 3 days: @fslosangeles and their fantastic restaurant: @CulinaLA. Actually, all the food at the hotel is beyond reproach and if you visit the Windows Bar make sure you order their Fiv

name: The Oculus at the World Trade Center
text: Ok I thought I was ready to be back in NYC after the serenity and quiet of Hawaii but I think this city girl got TOO used to that quiet because I didn't remember just how noisy the City is!!! That's another reason I'm loving spending tonight at the #BoseS

name: Shake Shack at Madison Square Park
text: Today was one of those mega stressful freelance-life days where I jungled no less than 10 things at once but the evening brought with it a very enjoyable event at the @HIPR offices and afterward I strolled through NYC toward my subway stop but changed cou

name: Griffith Observatory
text: You can drive to Griffith Observatory but why do so when you can also hike up a trail through the hills and emerge with the reward of this view? @dante8 and I opted for an early morning hike to this classic LA landmark and what a great day it is for such

text: Found out a crazy nature factoid while on our @RedJeepTours ride around the San Andreas Fault: it's actually one of the most naturally fertile areas in the whole of greater Palm Springs. But not in the way of rolling green fields or lush gardens. Instead,

name: Ft Lauderdale Beach
text: Little did I know that when I was in Ft. Lauderdale, one of the reasons it wasn't \blue sky and sunny\" the whole time is that we were experiencing the beginnings of Arthur -- which would end up nearly canceling my flight home and making for a very nerve

name: The Boardwalk At Venice Beach
text: Had to do it, had to get my toes in the sand at Venice Beach! Though SoCal has a ton of iconic beaches, when it comes time to choose just one, it is Venice that always comes to mind for me. I loved the town around it as well: the taco shops, the tattoo pa

text: From the minute I sat down at Edible Canada for a dinner hosted by Fairmont Waterfront, to the minute I finished the brunch that I returned for, and paid for on my own, days later - I sensed something very different about this bistro on Granville Island a

text: If you get the chance to #VisitCarlsbad, you most definitely should!! People here are just fantastic, the pace of life is so well balanced, nature is always a part of the flow and the sunshine...the sunshine!! This lovely alley leads from the beach to the

name: Getty Center
text: Do you like modern architecture? • I can never really get enough of The Getty Center. It’s like the MET was in New York for me, an endlessly fascinating source of inspiration that I look at a bit differently every time I visit. LEED-certified and desi

text: Did you know the Griffith was a park first, and then later the Observatory was added when Griffith J. Griffith (yes, that was really his full name) became enamored with astronomy? He first donated the land to the city in 1896 and in 1912 he offered the Ci

text: So glad @dante8 didn't want to leave Venice without also exploring the Canals. The Venice Canals were created in 1905 by developer Abbot Kinney as part of his \Venice of America\" plan. He literally wanted to recreate the appearance and feel of Venice, I

text: Since my mother, @paintthenight, is far away today it is just a normal work day for me, leading a photo tour of the Highline and the Meatpacking District for @walksofnewyork. Gorgeous day for it though, could hardly have asked for better weather. If you'r

name: The Dutch
text: Photographers don't always love dappled light. It can make things difficult, for portraits especially. But there's something I love about it in neighborhoods like SoHo or the West Village, and the way I feel when I'm strolling through those neighborhoods

text: The Kecak Fire Dance at Uluwatu is performed by a circle of bare-chested men wearing checked cloth around their waists, percussively chanting \cak\" and throwing up their arms, while actors in elaborate costumes enter and exit helping to depict a love st

text: In all my trips to Vancouver before this latest one, I'd somehow never been to Granville Island nor had I discovered the adorable ferry service that is the Aquabus. The staff at Fairmont Waterfront suggested I experience both on a day without scheduled ac

text: These offerings are just outside the gate of a family home in Ubud and they are one of my favorite things about Bali. It is the most Hindu of the islands which make up the country of Indonesia. My guide tried to explain the practice to me and I hope I tra

name: Getty Museum

text: Speaking of funky parts of LA and great neighborhoods, @dante8 and I stayed for several nights in Silver Lake and I really enjoyed it. The people are varied and interesting (outgoing and kind when you engage them), there are outdoor movies, a twice-weekly

text:
So that Vancouver storyline I wanted to continue was delayed by a stolen iPhone and all kinds of adventures of late....\
 .\
 But as promised, I wanted to finish posting about my latest trip to Canada, hosted by @fairmontwaterfront. It’s now one of my fav

text: Red, White and #ClassicCars Blue for Memorial Day! 🗽🇺🇸 I hope that you're making it a good day off from work if you're here in the US of A and if you're elsewhere, I'm just wishing you a happy start to the week 😊

name: New York, New York
text: To me, #NeverForget doesn't mean never forgive. But it does mean, forever we remember the lives that were lost 15 years ago today.
